Reviews.Title: “Don't book breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: 5c00t3er
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely not 4 star, but 3 at best. We booked two nights B and B but on the first morning when we went down to breakfast it was like a monkeys' tea party. Coffee is provided from three coffee machines, when we arrived, only two were working with a queue of about eight at each machine. Ten minutes later all three machines were out of service. The tables were not cleared as people left and it was every man for himself. The staff, like so many in the hotel industry in Spain, did their best: their best to avoid listening to customers' complaints or providing any remedial action. They disappeared with trolleys of dirty crockery and stayed gone. When we left tea or three of them were valiantly trying to fill orders for coffee at a bar espresso machine. That day I went to reception and told them we would not require breakfast the next morning, and, unlike in any reasonable hotel, was not asked if this was due to dissatisfaction, just told: "fine sir", while he tapped at a keyboard. Nevertheless they tried to bill me for two breakfasts on checkout. Don't book breakfast: bring a travel kettle and coffee and do a quick food shop in the supermarket directly under the hotel The rooms are basic and small but the addition of a balcony reduces the claustrophobia. Get a room with an odd number if you want more to see from your balcony and not have the sun shining in.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but be sure to lock valuables in the safe!!!”
Reviews.Author: leah2181
Reviews.Content: The Expo is located at a very convenient location a few meters from the Sants Station, with great access links to anywhere in the city and beyond via trains, metro and buses. Unfortunately, we were foolish enough to leave some cash in the room, without locking it in the safe (for which we weren't provided a key for upon check-in, or I'm sure we would have used it). I'm certain 50 Euros was stollen by housekeeping, but when I sopke to hotel staff about our predicament, they told us that as we'd signed a form upon check-in stating that anything left unlocked in the rooms whilst unattended were basically not their problem. I was disgusted with their attitude. It's a shame that safes appear to ultimately keep your possessions safe from the cleaners. If you do stay here, be sure to use the safe!! I suppose we were lucky they didn't take all the cash we left there.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay - nothing special”
Reviews.Author: seosamh90
Reviews.Content: We booked a twin/double, when I went to confirm, they said there was no doubles so we had I pay 10 euro to get a double. Seems to have happened to a few more. Wifi wasn't free and when I tried to use it, it was slow. No bath tub. Good location, close to SANTS station. Nice friendly staff and nice restaurant. Rooms were clean and satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - handy location in exciting city”
Reviews.Author: PaddyWhacked36
Reviews.Content: As previous reviewers have stated, selling point here is its under 5 minute walk to city's main train and metro station. Disappointed with reception staff's lack of interest and pro-activity in advising re facilities, sights, offers etc. Some had very little English. As advised on Tripadvisor, we booked executive room - very average - would not like to have seen basic room! No water / teasmade; had to request more soap, poor fridge contents; wi-fi in rooms but subject to charge. Had dinner in restaurant on day of arrival - very limited, but staff very friendly and helpful. (The Roma restaurant across the road provided two excellent fillet steaks the following night). Buffet breakfast was average, but on the Sunday, the large crowd could not be accomodated- food / juices ran out and long queues for coffee meant that food was cold when we got back to table. Did get call on night of return home from manager, not apologising, but thanking us for comments left. As for the city -wow, so exciting and definitely worth a visit! Try and take in a Barca match, even if your'e not a football fan.While the match wasn't great, the experience was amazing.What I particularly liked (apart from the Messi and Iniesta skills) was the absence of any hint of rowdyism; also, the presence of many elderly couples . Beware though, a can of Coke cost Euro 4! Take a hop on/ hop off, a great way to get your bearings and an overview of what's to see. Our favourites were the Montjuic area, which included the 1992 Olympic statium, Parc Guell, with its Gaudi treats, and above all, the still unfinished Sagrada Familia basilica. While the outside is wonderful, the inside is truly beautiful (the nearest thing to heaven on this earth!), and well worth the queuing. Finally, a few tips: the metro is great value and easy to use. A ten trip ticket costing Eur 9.65 gives access to trains, metro and buses - we travelled back to the airport on this. Be prepared for hilly walks, if going to Park Guell! Despite the city's reputation for pickpockets, we did not encounter any trouble, but were always watchful.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MFPIV
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona a couple of days before and after a cruise. We chose the hotel because of the price and access to transportation. At the time it was $152 Euro/night. I cannot complain about any experience we had at the hotel. We arrive early both from the fligh, and the return from the cruise (8am), and we were checked into a clean room very quickly. The hotel is conviniently located across from Santa Barcelona Estacio, which had both rail and subway access to the rest of the city. The rest of the area didn't seem to have much outside of a few restaurants (we didn't try). Both rooms we had on both stays were clean, and the staff was friendly and attentive during our entire stay. I cannot say there was anything "special" but there was certainly nothing terribly wrong about the property either. I would recommend the hotel for anyone who is looking to stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Marathon -excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Karl C
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Expo hotel for Barca marathon. Great location for start/finish and they put on a special dinner for runners the night before the race. Really friendly staff and v helpful. They can give you discounts on a range of tourist options around the city. Rooms are fairly standard for a predominantly business hotel but just what you need and reasonably priced. The location means its a short train journey from the airport (20mins max) and a 2 min walk from the station. There is a swimming pool but closed until April/May. Would recommend this for a weekend city break hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there !!! First room dirty, no double bed and try to cheat on us”
Reviews.Author: Christian19850212
Reviews.Content: We booked the Expo Hotel for one night, a standard room (double/twin bed). They first room was smelly and with twin bed, so we ask for room with double bed. The only room that we could get was on the 10th floor (without elevator!!!!). We decide to take a upgrade for 5€ and get finally get a normal/basic room. Location is okay but i will never go again to this hotel. Next day when we made checkout next surprise 63€ + 5€ = 68€ should be our price but instead they try to charge us 78€. Okay they can make mistake but when i start to argue and show them how much it should be they become unfriendly and it took 30min of fighting to pay the real price. Don't go there

Reviews.Title: “Excellently located...just right hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nicki1512
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I took a 3 days city trip to Barcelona just last week and I booked this hotel a month ago on Booking.com. My initial price was 203.79 Euros, payable on check out. The hotel is just across the road from the Santa Barcelona Estacio, which provides metro links to the city and beyond and also the main rail line from the Airport. Arriving earlier than scheduled and with a smooth run from the airport by the R2 railway to Sants was great, and I thought we may have to wait to check in, as it stated 1500 but we turned up at 1300 and still was able to get our room. The receptionist was friendly and spoke very good English; although I tried out my very basic Spanish on her she was great! - Thank you. We were offered the upgrade, from basic to executive due to the standard rooms having twin beds. So we accepted at an extra 5 Euros a night. The lobby area is fresh, clean and very modern. The lifts were quick and clean, and the approach to our room on the 9th floor was clean. The hotel chambermaids were friendly and welcomed us with a cheery 'Hola Buenos dias'. The room itself I would not consider 'Executive' however not having stayed or looked into a standard room I wouldn’t be able to compare nor comment. But in my opinion was more of a standard room compared to some Executive rooms I have stayed in throughout Europe. We didn’t take the breakfast offered at 8 Euros (from the reception) as there is a cafe in the stations that had plenty of light bites and coffee, both of us had cafe con leche (like a latte) and croissants and a sandwich for 13 Euros. Upon check out on day three I was surprised by my bill, as even though we upgraded to the ‘Executive’ room the bill actually still only came to 203 Euros, which turned out to be the same price I booked for a standard room. Hope this was blind luck on my part and that the hotel doesn’t take more money off me now I have posted it! :) I know this is a review for a hotel but I thought I would mention how great the transport links are in and out of the centre of the city, we used a T-10 ticket which allowed 10 trips to any station on the metro in Zone 1 much like the oyster card for the underground in London. Also the Barcelona tourist bus, we used it, 24 Euros for a full day, which was enough to get around the blue and red lines, which took you past all the usual and prominent tourist attractions... also back to our hotel (stopping at Sants station). All in all a great stop and well worth staying at the Expo Hotel Barcelona for great city links and a friendly environment. Thanks to the staff at the Expo.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: surflicka
Reviews.Content: The good: - Close to city center, arenas shopping center, and la plaza espana. - Executive rooms were decent The bad: - No irons in the bedrooms. We had to request one and they were short on irons so I shared one with a neighbor - Sewage smell coming from the drainage. It was pretty awful. I got used to it. Some of the others I knew that were staying there had the same issue. - No gym - Limited food options on bar and dinner menu - No complimentary internet - Rooms on executive level could use some updating I stayed here for business and it was fine. I would definitely not stay here for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “we recomend it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: annanina2802
Reviews.Content: at first we were not very satisfacted with the standard room that we had booked... but when we asked to change it (ofcourse with some more money), and we went to the 7th floor at the exclusive rooms.... it was fantastic!!! probably one of the best hotel rooms we have ever stayed. The view incredible (straight at the park), the stuff too, the room very clean and big,the bathroom amazing, and much more. We stayed at number 773, we suggest it to all. ONLY negative, a little bit noise, but believe me it wont mind at all!!!! Book it early for the better price possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: rachelamanda
Reviews.Content: The price of the hotel for 1 night at 50€ a room was fantastic. We booked 2 rooms and there was 2 adults and a child in each room. There are sofas beds in the rooms so these were made up for the children at no extra cost. The staff were so friendly and helpful in both the reception and the restaurant. Breakfast was very busy and whilst a few things were running out the satff remained very helpful and efficient and the quality and variety of what was offered for breakfast was outstanding. The location of the Hotel just infront of Sants station made it easy to get to (we travelled by train) and very close to the metro for getting around Barcelona. The bedrooms arent anything special but were clean and anyway who goes to Barcelona to stay in their room. I would definatly reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expo Hotel Barcelona - Spanish Grand Prix”
Reviews.Author: ForzaJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Expo Hotel in May 2011 for the Spanish Grand Prix at the Circuit de Catalunya. This hotel is a 2 minute walk from Barcelona Sants train station, which is 3 or 4 stops from the airport and 7 or 8 stops to the circuit (Montmello Station). You can get anywhere in Barcelona from this station - 1 train to both the Nou Camp and Las Ramblas. The hotel itself was quite nice. Restaurant had a poor choice of food but can't really comment on it as we did not eat there. The roof terrace and BBQ Bar were really nice - we spent most of our time up there when not at the track. The food from the BBQ (burger/chicken/fish with jacket potato and salad) was nice and reasonably priced, 10 euro. Pint was 5 euro, half pint 3 euro and sangria was 13 euro a glass. There is also a pool which closed at 6pm, the bar was open til gone 1am. The staff were friendly and the guys at reception were happy to help and very knowledgable. I would definately return and am actually planning on it within the next few years, provided the grand Prix stays at Circuit de Cat.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Pixienixie
Reviews.Content: Took my boyfriend to Barcelona for hos 30th, had champagne in the room on arrival and the hotel also organised a cake which was lovely. Was not expecting anything too amazing as the hotel was very reasonably priced but I felt the service was 5 star. The receptionist was so lovely and friendly and we had a welcome call as soon as we were in our room to ensure all was ok. The room was spacious and clean and the bathroom was nice. The location was very good for train stations, but would have prefered to be slightly closer to the centre and beach although did not take too long to get the on the train which was close by and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic breakfast, shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: Phewtorquay
Reviews.Content: Finding this hotel was easy. Just get off the underground at Tarragona, and its about 2 blocks away. The reception and my room was spotlessly clean. The breakfast was buffet style and excellent. The only drawback with this modern hotel was the noise. The traffic noise was consderable even with the windows closed and the walls paper thin. However, I suspect that traffic noise would be an issue wherever you stayed in Barcelona. Opposite the hotel are several restaurants. I tried the Italian for an evening meal, and it was very good and a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy but close to train Station”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethBrett
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is situated very close to the main train station and metro, I have stayed in far better hotels. The staff were very friendly and the buffet breakfast was great but I did NOT have a good night sleep! The walls are paper thin and I heard lots of late night activity...... A good locaton for easy commuting, but not for a good night sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: soirbleuu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on the second leg of our honeymoon. We spent the first leg in Paris, with a similar hotel budget. Based on our Paris hotel budget and what we got, I'd argue that you get a great deal with Expo Hotel and its amenities. The hotel is situated in a quiet neighborhood that is within a 15-20 minute subway ride to the majority of attractions in Barcelona. (Bonus- the hotel is directly across from a metro station) In addition, the restaurant offers a decent meal, although I'd highly advise eating elsewhere for your money's worth. The room was spacious and the bed was comfortable- added to its safe surroundings and I'd say this hotel has more than enough of what you need while in Barcelona. We were able to do all that we wanted to do in our trips time despite not being on Las Ramblas, and the hotels we saw on/near Las Ramblas for the same price were nowhere near the same quality or aesthetics. I'm a huge proponent for staying off the beaten path in a new city, and was very happy we chose Expo Hotel as it left us both with an overall favorable experience in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortably near train and subway station to walk even with your luggages.”
Reviews.Author: CesarCris
Reviews.Content: Very quiet and comfortably near the arena (east), the train and subway station to walk even with luggage. Excellent buffet breakfast for 10 euro (gotta try their sausage). Many places to the south walking distance. Easy subway ride to La Rambla. Best of all - the hotel rate so unbelievable for a 4 star. The picture shows how close the train station is.

Reviews.Title: “VALUE/CONVENIENT HOTEL BARCELONA”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: I live in Southern Catalonia and always stay at this hotel when visiting Barcelona, mainly because it's conveniently situated right next to Sants station and particularly outside peak periods is extremely good value - never paid more than 50 euros a night which for a reasonable standard hotel in Barcelona is certainly not a rip off. The cheaper rooms are basic but not that bad and satisfactory for one or two nights stay. (Some of the reviewers here and elsewhere seem to want Savoy, London standards for peanuts! If I'm paying over 500 euros a night I expect perfection, but not under 50 euros. Get real people! In my opinion this hotel compares favourably with any similarly priced hotel in the major European cities where I have stayed, particularly London.) Administration could do with improving. Have had two irritating problems. 1. Was once given the key to a room already occupied - good nobody was in bed or naked! Quickly solved. 2. Once a friend and I booked two single rooms (confirmed by email) via internet but on arrival only one was available. Quickly solved by giving me an executive room at no extra cost. Staying there again shortly.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: singalong100
Reviews.Content: We were on a four night " Room only" stay in Barcelona and felt we could not have made a better choice of hotel as far as the location went. The main Station( Barc Sants) is literally round the corner. There are direct trains from the airport to this station. Very pleasant walk from the station to the hotel if one took the long route. however, what we found very economical was buying a two- day ticket on their open bus sight seeing tours. It took us everywhere and what it left out we could easily do by subway which is in the main Station a few metres away. The best part was a wonderful supermarket("hypermarcat") next door with a cafe where breakfast could be varied every morning. A couple of reasonably priced restaurants nearby for meals. The room and ensuite weren't large, but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: mickinge
Reviews.Content: A few minutes walk from the BARC SANTS railway stn. (From Barcelona Airport about 20 mins) Great Place and a fantastic price. This is truly a 4 star Hotel with a 2 star Tariff. Has all the things business travellers need. The follow up contact by reception on the check in process etc is a nice touch and supports their customer focus. Selection of Restaurants across the road compliments the Hotels own Dining facilities. Just a fantastic hotel with exceptional value for money.

Reviews.Title: “stinking bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: trillian78
Reviews.Content: at first i thought it is a good hotel, but after the awful smell of toilet was in the whole room. doors to the room were very bad, you can really here everything in the hall. so no tight sleep was possible. bathroom and mini bar were generously stocked but however you always had to think about closing the door of the toilett. breakfast was okay. bar closed early and barkeepers were not that nice. maybe all the factors were okay, but the bathroom was just old.... internet wifi was bad and slow, and costly (10 euro)

Reviews.Title: “single rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelTulip2
Reviews.Content: Single rooms are at end of the corridors and are outdated. Shower curtain in the bathroom and all is extremely small.....

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel ....”
Reviews.Author: BECKYHEARTSNYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Expo in September and found it to be a really good hotel and great value for money. The location of the hotel is great, literally as soon as you walk out of Sants Station it is in front of you so no trouble finding it. The reception area is very nice and modern, and the check in was fast and the staff were helpful and friendly, offering us city maps and leaflets etc. The room was quite large, it had 2 twin beds, a small room with a safe, drawers and rail with hangers for clothes and it also had a couch, a big TV and a mini bar (although the prices were quite expensive we used it to put our own drinks in!!). The bathroom was also very big with a bath and a shower and there was also a balacony with a table and chairs. I cannot fault the room, it was cleaned daily and had towels/toiletries with a hairdryer. We didn't use the pool but people were around it daily and it was an ok sized pool area but the bar on the roof was nice with good views of the city but very expensive. There is a place next to the hotel that sells pastries/croissants etc and also a supermarket that was quite reasonable in price. There is also a macdonalds in the station and other food places. Overall i would definately recommend staying at this hotel and cannot fault it really. As one of the cheapest hotels we could find i was really surpised at how good it was for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: Aseif
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel. From its location, (very near the barcelona station), to its room and overall service!. The room was big and had amenities aplenty. The bathroom was big and fully stocked. I think the staff was just brilliant. One of them booked a show for me on the night that i arrived as well as arranged a taxi. He was very helpful and all the staff was kind and polite. they even helped with my bags when the porters weren't around. These guys really make the hotel a great place. The only downside was no breakfast. But for 68 euros, i ain't complaining!

Reviews.Title: “the biggest problem of the hotel is staff”
Reviews.Author: Geichenko
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself is OK, but reception was a disaster. we stayed there 2 nights and I will never ever go back to this hotel. Clean room, good location is nothing comparing to a terrible attitude that we got immediately at the reception. Front desk was rude, charged my credit card twice, when i was tried to explain the problem they stopped understanding English. Did not give any explanations, and were extremely rude. It was my worst experience in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, close to Metro and train station”
Reviews.Author: Traveling-engineer73
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, a little outside the centre, but close to Metro and Train station. With the metro just 5 minutes away from the centre. Breakfast was good, rooms could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, overrated”
Reviews.Author: marianthony
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days in an executive room. The location is excellent, closed to Sants Station , Metro and Hop On and Off Turistic Bus Stop. Few minutes walking from Plaza Espanya and Magic Fountain of Montjuïc. The staff was friendly and attentive. The hotel is clean and comfortable, leaking shower, roomy but noisy. The beds are made every day and the room cleaned. The buffet breakfast each morning had quite a variety. The problem is the environment. It is a classic bussines hotel, beside that, no free wifi available. Overpiced for what we got Not smart enough for a 4 star hotel and facilities not good enough to be a 4 star

Reviews.Title: “unforgivible mistake”
Reviews.Author: maxinesmom
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel early, and after traveling all night, I was happy and relieved that they were willing to check us in without delay. Unfortunately, they had us in a room with twin beds, while my print out confirmed that we reserved one double, so the receptionist merely put us in another room. Tired, we took our baggage upstairs, excited to plop down into the bed, and we put the key card in the door, opened it, and found ANOTHER GUEST ALREADY IN THE ROOM! Fortunately he was not in a state of undress (or worse) or the uncomfortable situation could have been very embarrassing. When we went back down to tell them, they apologized and gave us another room, but with no compensation for our awkward situation. They were equally blase with the other guest who followed us downstairs understandably furious. We had ordered an upgraded room and it was fine, if a bit cold. I appreciated the terry robes. But I did not like that a desk jutted out into the thin hallway leading to the bathroom. I bumped into it at night. The code that was given for the internet did not work, I don't know if it was due to the room mess up, but I chose to not keep trying for another password, it was too expensive. Everything else was ok, pretty good location and very good price, but after a mess up like that, I just cannot recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Acctg_girl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and found the staff service great. We ended up eating in the hotel restaurant and drinking at the bar. Nice hotel, rooms were being renovated when we arrived however our room was adequate. Very close to train station a couple of minutes to doorstep which was great as we arrived by train. Metro close to get into the central city, we did walk into the centre the first day which took about a hour and took metro back to hotel. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel epic location”
Reviews.Author: Emmetm1
Reviews.Content: Despite Barcelona been a dive, this hotel is nice not incredible but it is nice. The hotel is located slap bang in the middle of the city and I mean dead center. Its a 2 minute walk from the central train station. A taxi from the airport cost me and two other lads 28euro with 6 bags. Approaching the hotel you pass a five star which looks incredible but dont get your hopes up the expo is behind it!! The roof top bar is really nice at night with great views of the city and the roof top pool is nice too. The rooms are sufficiently large. We got a 3 bed room which was 2 doubles and a couch but we were there for 1 night so we diddn't care. The staff are alright (I was using a different phrase but this wouldn't get posted if i did) and cant count so check your change!! however we found this a problem where ever we went in spain THEY CANT COUNT! All in all I would recommend this hotel for a short stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - good location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Jeff871
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a 3 night city break, and we weren't sure what to expect but were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is very close to the Estacio De Sants station which is a major train station giving easy access to the Metro and airport and buses. The open top bus tour goes from here as well. Check in was very efficient and they were very helpful. We decided to upgrade to an executive room which was only an extra 12 euro per night. The room was clean and a good size so we were very happy. It's great the hotel has a pool and sunbeds on the roof which kept the wife happy! We were fortunate to get tickets to see Barcelona play at the Nou Camp and this hotel is perfectly located for it. We got the metro to the ground (only a few stops away), and then walked back (15 minute walk). We didn't eat in the hotel, but one night we went across to the Hotel Torres Catalunya which is opposite, and ate in their restaurant because they have one on the 23rd floor with great views over Barcelona. All in all the hotel was excellent and reasonably priced. Would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Tired. Probably a three star”
Reviews.Author: Snookoafc1
Reviews.Content: Went there on business, visiting a trade show nearby. Had an 'Executive Room', but there was little evidence of the frills, only robes which were, as usual too small. Wi-fi had to be paid for which is unusual with 'executive rooms' it usually comes as part of the enhanced package. The rate was €10 a day. It should be free to everyone as it costs the hotel nothing, so it is a rip-off whichever and wherever an hotel charges it. If my room was an 'executive room' the standard rooms must be poor. It was clean, but very tired. The staff were good and attentive, but frankly the location isn't worth what they charge for staying there. The key cards work hit-and-miss I wasn't the only one traipsing back to reception to have a new key cut. The place did not stack up to a four-star, which is its official rating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Elisa H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice! the location is ok near Sants Estacio and Placa Espanya, but a bit far away from the city centre. I had a room in the 9th floor, with an amazing view to Montjuic. The swimming pool area at the roof was great. The only cons are that the wifi was not free and that breakfast was not icluded.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, we'll come back!”
Reviews.Author: jabbott_uk
Reviews.Content: Went to Barcelona from the 1st Sept to the 6th and stayed at the Expo Hotel for 5 nights. We got to the hotel from the airport via the Renfe train service from the Airport (pictures clearly posted to help non-spanish speakers find it!) to Barcelona Sants train station. It took about 15 mins on the train costing €3.50 each, and when we got out of the station the Hotel was right there. No more than a 90 second walk, though don't worry about hearing trains all night, cause like the subway, the train station is underground. We checked in easily and they gave us some free hotel-made papers with different places to visit and opening times etc. This was very useful and was gratefully accepted. We had booked an executive room and so were on the 8th floor at the front of the hotel. Nice views all round, bed was comfy and staff were welcoming. We used a safe at a cost of €3 per day. We bought a rail pass for €25 each which gave us 5 days unlimited travel on all trains, subways and buses. Would strongly recommend, they also do shorter and longer times if need be. Went up to the roof terrace which is open till 1am. Had a pint and a glass of average wine. We ordered a pizza to share and at €11 we were disappointed to find it was a mass-made Dr. Ouitker pizza that Tesco's sell in the UK for about £2! We had breakfast the first morning in the hotel for €10 each, just for ease of use (3rd floor resturant), though were glad not to have booked breakfast every morning as it was average. During our trip we were very happy with the room, the cleanliness and cleaning-staff and staff in reception. We however got the feeling (this was for the entire holiday, not just the Expo) that the staff in any bar and/or roof terrace would favour serving spanish visitors before others. The pool on a floor above the 10th roof terrace bar provided fresh towels and enough sun loungers for a small army. The pool was smallish but did the job. It wasn't as 'spit-spot' clean as I was hoping, but as it's coming to the end of the season, I imagine they'll clean it soon! The air conditioning was brilliant in our room, and did the job nicely, the fans however made a constant noise on the roof when you wanted to sunbathe by the pool. Our room was quiet and peaceful until the last morning when the person next door had an alarm going off from 7:30am. After 25 mins I rang up reception and they said they'd send someone up to sort it. though another 25 mins later it was still going off. We booked through lastminute.com and for flights, car parking and hotel, we got it all for £330 each, so good value I think! Hotel was excellent and we were happy to get a nicer hotel for a cheaper price, by just having to travel to the Las Ramblas by a 5 minute (air-conditioned!) tube. Try to avoid eating at the hotel, partly cause its not great food, and partly because you're in Barcelona so you should go out and get some culture! We will happily stay at the hotel again, but may be more abrupt with Bar staff!

Reviews.Title: “Terrace and pool make this a great hotel, huge beds make for a great nights sleep. Would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: LIZMS
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel for the money but can be quite noisy early morning as you can hear the cleaners moving furniture etc. Location within waking distance of Montjuic - great for the fountain and light shows and near to a metro stop, only a short few stops from the Ramblas. We didn't have breakfast as 15euros, very nice bakery next door and cafe across road, much cheaper. Rooms large and huge bed if you go for executive room, pool area and terrace is fantastic. Great for chilling out and topping up your tan.

Reviews.Title: “nothing for free :)”
Reviews.Author: ArtemZ
Reviews.Content: Nothing special but nothing bad. As per me it’s better to stay at some cheaper hotel but in the city center. Negative: You have to pay for everything: for safe box in room and WI FI.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return to this hotel....don't believe bad reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Memma87
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at this hotel, it doesn't look like much from the outside. We arrived by taxi at night so we didn't have a great idea of where the Metro station was. The next morning we were thrilled to realize that the station was less that 3 minutes walk from the hotel door. We had paid the extra for the Executive Room and it was well worth the extra money. Bed was comfortable. Nice view from the balcony. The room itself was basic enough, but the bathroom was lovely and spacious, with it's own seperate balcony. Sheets were changed every day and towels replaced. Room service was great value. The use of a safe was less than €4 per day. I think it was around €3.50. There is a supermarket, downstairs, next door to the hotel where you can buy bottles of water, beer and snacks. We ate in the hotel a couple of nights. We had the barbeque on the rooftop terrace and the views were gorgeous. Food was fantastic value too.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for flight next morning”
Reviews.Author: Rodomaster
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because it was next to the train station for the ride to the airport the next day. It's a nice hotel with a good size room with English TV news channels on the telly. We enjoyed a lunch at a place accross the street and we also enjoyed the breakfast for 9 euros each. We also had dinner at the roof-top restaurant that was OK. For flying out of Barcelona, this hotel is a good option. Just be aware it takes a little time to buy your train ticket to the airport. It's a big train station & a bit confusing to understand what train windows to buy your ticket from! For first timers to Barcelona like me it was difficult to figure out!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Central and Great!”
Reviews.Author: andante777
Reviews.Content: I chose the Expo Barcelona for its location. The hotel is located a block away from the St. Sants Train Terminal, from which you can hop on a train for day trips to various locations , including Barcelona’s beaches. It is also close to the Green Line metro station, which takes you to the Eixample District, and The Sagrada Familia, Gaudi's famous cathedral. For 11 euros I purchased a train ticket at the airport, which got me to St.Sants Terminal and on the Metro for several trips. The hotel was much more than I expected, as sometimes hotels so close to big terminals can be questionable. Expo Barcelona is quite fine, very clean and the décor is modern and very tasteful. They exhibit some interesting art work, especially on the floor where the dining and conference rooms are located. On your first day, I recommend the terrace bar, as it affords expansive views of the city, especially Montjuic, and The Palau Nacional. It's a great place to leisurely regroup, meet friends,have a bite and a drink, and enjoy the view. The hotel offers a great breakfast buffet for a surprisingly affordable price. Staff is helpful and polite, clientele is international. Expo Barcelona is a good, and very convenient place to stay, at an affordable price: abouot $128.66 US for two nights mid season. (including taxes and fees) The room was small, but comfortable, with a nice full modern bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to all, without the high price tag.”
Reviews.Author: EMM19
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. The hotel staff are very helpful. The rooftop bar was great...the staff were very hospitable. The rooms are clean. The hotel is close to all transportation and sites to visit. Will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: AJ30064
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Expo five nights in mid-July, in an "executive" room with a balcony. The hotel room was basic, but the public areas were nice and designed for socializing. The buffet breakfast each morning had quite a variety, including assorted cereals, scrambled eggs and quiche, bacon and sausage, sauteed mushrooms, baked tomatoes, several juices, breads, fruits and sweets, and excellent coffee. The location is superb if you're planning on using the Metro for transportation -- it's right next to the Sants station. From Sants you can get anywhere in Barcelona. Also, you can get a T-10 ticket and take a Renfe train from the airport to Sants, then have nine rides left on the Metro or the airport train for seeing the city. The bar/restaurant and pool on the roof are perfect for relaxing. We paid about $100 a night, and thought it was a great value. I would rate the hotel building about on the level of an older Holiday Inn, but in an excellent location and with a much better breakfast. Sign up for a free Expo rewards card before you go and breakfast is complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “clean, spacious, excellent buffet breakfast - and great to have a pool for such a price!”
Reviews.Author: sldkf
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, spacious rooms, decent facilities.. A great hotel to stay in with family - not least because the copious buffet breakfast is free for children! We enjoyed the pool ( a bit smaller than the website photos suggest!) adn the sun terrace, and the location is great - near the main Sants station, and well connected by metro adn bus to more or less anywhere you can think of!

Reviews.Title: “Nice pre/post cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: AddiesGrammy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location after a cruise from Barcelona. The location is an easy metro ride from the port area. The train station is right next door and a metro stop is just around the corner. The hotel was clean and had plenty of room. The staff were very helpful. One thing that bothers me is that they do charge for a lot of extras. The internet is not included, the hotel room safe is a fee per use situation, and breakfast is quite pricey. In this day and age, internet is a basic need for travellers and farily cheap for businesses to provide. You hear about the theft problems in Barcelona and they charge you if you want to make sure you stuff is secure, and most people have a morning routine of waking up to a cup of coffee. But if you want that you must pay.... I prefer for the rooms to have a kettle or coffee maker to make the mornings go smoothly. But overall the hotel did a fine job for us.

Reviews.Title: “Well located - very clean but food expensive...”
Reviews.Author: PJMN
Reviews.Content: Just back from 5 days in this hotel. Centrally located (100m from Sants Estacio Station (major hub for metro, bus and trains) - basically means you can get to anywhere in the city with ease. Basic accommodation, but very clean rooms - new towels daily - TV in room. Very good air conditioning system. Swimming pool on the roof. Staff very friendly and helpful. Only downside being the high cost of food (which wasn't included in our package) - e.g. continental breakfast E15 per person. Similar available directly across the road in a small cafe, at a cost of E5.40 (for the two of us!). All in all - would go back - but would arrange meals elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Suzan71
Reviews.Content: The folks that work at this hotel were really nice and although I didn't need them to they speak very good English. The hotel was clean and decor was contemporary modern. They provide guests with robes and slippers but the robes were not soft but rather rough and itchy. I guess my only disappointment was that on my whole Spain trip (Madrid-Barcelona) this was the most expensive of the hotels but they don't provide free wifi in the lobby like the other hotels did and their TVs were the old small big tube TVs. The other hotels including the ones in the small city of Granada were large flat screen. English channels are provided but they are all news channels. But then again on the plus side they had an amazing view from their terrace roof top and again, staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “not an hotel for business trips”
Reviews.Author: PARISFRIEND
Reviews.Content: NOISY NOISY NOISY never go up to floor 9 just under the pool and bar people walk on your head and move the chairs it s horrible when you have to wake up early to work... wifi is not free difficult to acess with iphone long procedure...

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: walter6504
Reviews.Content: Good points: 1. Friendly staff 2. 3rd floor business centre, reading, and dining zone. 3. Café and small pool on roof 4. Beside train station and metro station 5. Nice shops nearby during weekdays 6. Coffee machine in lobby (1,20 euro/cup) 7. Good air conditioning Bad points: 1. You have to pay for the Internet and it is very slow (max is 50kbits/sec) 2. No electric kettle in room 3. Cannot regulate water temperature for shower properly. 4. TV takes up desk space. It needs to be a wall mounted LCD. 5. Breakfast is quite expensive. Coffee & roll for 15 euro. (go to a café around the corner) 6. Beds and linens are showing wear. 7. Towels are not commercial grade and are worn. 8. Weak room lighting. Not really good for reading. 9. Use of room safe is about 4 euros/night. 10. Walls need more prints/color. Four while walls and a white ceiling of same shade. 11. Some noise from other parts of hotel, but not too bad. 12. Only one electric outlet available in room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly Service at a convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: scliffy
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed by the helpfulness and courtesy of the staff at this hotel. We were there only one night, in a group which included children and which needed four rooms, but wished we had booked to stay longer. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and that was at a very busy time. The hotel is very near Sants Station and just the place to stay after a late night arrival on the train. The rooms are a little dated, but everything we needed was there and worked. The breakfast was first class, the best we had anywhere in our month long touring Europe, with great variety and good service. It is a little way out of the centre, but with easy access from the Metro. We came away determined to return to this hotel in Barcelona for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: tetts92
Reviews.Content: Located very close to the train and metro, very good service. Delicious breakfast. Spacious rooms with very comfortable beds. Only disadvantage was that the walls of the rooms were very thin, so a lot of noise could be heard.

Reviews.Title: “Handy”
Reviews.Author: ibnewshound
Reviews.Content: Expo Hotel is very near Sants Station with direct train service to Airport. Also train from Sants metro station to Dessanes metro which is a couple of minutes walk from shuttle bus to cruise terminal. Much much cheaper than taxis ! T10 ticket (Eu 8 ?) good for 10 journeys on busses , Metro & train to airport; valid until about January following year. Have heard of people sharing a T10, just feed the ticket through a second time for 2nd person! Hotel quite good, extensive buffet breakfast. Staff friendly. Book direct online "best price" & get free wifi, welcome drink, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, GREAT food.”
Reviews.Author: FrozenPopsicles
Reviews.Content: We ran with the bulls in Pamplona, and stayed here both before and after our run. Hotel was good, food was GREAT. The breakfast was absolutely the BIGGEST I have ever seen.Nine kinds of breads, seven kinds of breakfast cereal, six types of juice, etc. Un-be-lievable. Reasonable price and very close (walking distance)to all the major bus,subway and train routes.I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “below expectations”
Reviews.Author: Radiolina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Expo hotel last week-end with my husband, and was expecting something better. First thing, I had specifically asked for a room with a double bed when booking it on booking.com. When we entered the room, there were 2 beds separated by a bedside table which you couldn't move, so I called reception but they told me ALL rooms are like that, apart from the executive rooms (more expensive) in which you get two beds but side by side, and anyway, none was available. They could have told us upon arrival knowing what we had asked for! So forget about this hotel's normal rooms if you're looking for a romantic week-end. The room itself was quite large, but I wouldn't define it as nice, decoration consisted in 1 painting, the sheets had holes in them, which is not acceptable in a four star hotel, and the sink in the bathroom smelled bad...the tv was old and could only be seen from 1 of the two beds because the room was long and narrow...The room wasn't terrible, but it was definitely not 4 star standard. So all of this is not worth the almost 80€/night without breakfast. Ok, it's Barcelona, but still... Only good point is the location, next to Sants railway station, and L5 an L3 metro, which makes it very practical, but it also made our balcony have a stunning view of the Hertz car rental parking next to Sants and of the station itself. I might stay there again, but would look for a cheaper offer, and only because the proximity to Sants can be important, and because in general picking a hotel in Barcelona can be a roulette, so at least you know what you get with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Close to Train Station”
Reviews.Author: bbucker13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right next to the main train station, which has connecting lines to everywhere you want to go. The train to the airport took about 25 minutes. We stayed for 4 nights in a large clean room. The staff spoke English which was very helpful. While there was not too much to do right next to the hotel, we found a couple of good restaurants very close and were able to take the subway each day to our destinations. The hotel was priced right and the only drawback was that the walls were a bit thin, we could hear the our neighbor's conversations. Also if you book through the hotel you receive free internet for the duration of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but noisy room...”
Reviews.Author: GENTguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, close to the central station and metrostop. Hotel looks quite stylish, and is very clean! Only beds are not that comfy as they are quite noisy. You can hear everything from neighbours and street. Our room was at the ninth floor and we had great view over Placa Espanya! And breakfast was lovely!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stop in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: baiyzet
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel twice in two nights in late April, were satisfied. A good hotel, with convenient transportation access: -up to the Spanish Steps and Fountain Montjuic 10 minutes of slow walking, -La-Rambla to 10 minutes by metro station is 100 meters from the hotel. Sants Station is the central, 100 meters from the hotel near-nice green park (Spain Industry) Comfortable rooms, friendly staff. Good restaurant on the 2nd floor. Rooftop pool, from the roof a good view of the city. Disadvantages of this hotel are: A paid Internet.

Reviews.Title: “book online”
Reviews.Author: sdfhassan2001
Reviews.Content: the location is very reasonable although away from the main touristic sites but it is very will connected to them by the metro stations, the train station ( and through it directly to the airport ) and the touristic bus station. so location is not an issue. the best way to book is through their web site where you will get the best price. when you book online you get also free internet access. it is just the next building to the very obvious tower (Hotel Torre Catalunya ) that you will see from the exit of the sants train station ( the exit that is opposite to Mc Donald exit). the staff in general are friendly and helpful. however the individaul rooms size are small with really small shower. rooms are clean and room service is very good. the break fast is good. if you want a space you need to updrade to a bigger room. the area around is very safe.

Reviews.Title: “You get a lot for your money...”
Reviews.Author: Tedar2001
Reviews.Content: For less than 75€ per night, I got a recently updated and relatively large executive room with a view of Montjiuc, modern bathroom, individually controlled AC that worked (important for summer), and wi-fi that worked in the room. If you book on-line directly with the hotel, you get free wi-fi and a welcome drink in the 3rd floor bar. Neighborhood-wise, the hotel is 1 block from Tarragona metro station (10 minutes to Liceu and Catalunya stations), 2 blocks from Sants railroad station, and 4 blocks from Plaza Espanya (metro, new Arenas mall, and Aerobus). There are neighborhood-type bars and restaurants plus supermarkets within a one block radius of the hotel, and it's safe. But this is not a tourist-oriented neighborhood like Ramblas or Catalunya so it shuts down after work. Regarding the hotel, staff is helpful and the restaurants were surprisingly good. The top floor terrace restaurant during warm weather months features an outdoor barbecue where I enjoyed a delicious lamb brochette dinner with a glass of cava overlooking the National Art Gallery. The minuses I experienced: the front desk was overwhelmed at checkin/out, the room decoration is soul-less even the executive rooms, the business center was too complicated for printing even my boarding pass for departure flight, and the tile floor in the room causes you to hear sounds from above (though I couldn't hear sounds from adjoining rooms and the hotel was full. I'd recommend this hotel is you want to get a lot of hotel for your money and you don't mind taking the metro (very safe and cheap) or cab to sights.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish business-friendly hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: jayrhino
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located. It is just around the corner from Barcelona Sans with direct trains to the airport. It's also only a 15 mins walk to the new exhibition centre. Despite its central location, the room was quiet even with open window, but you don't have to open the window, as the aircon unit works very well too. The room was nice with free wifi, the bathroom spotless, and the reception very friendly and helpful. On the 3rd floor, the hotel has a funky cafe / bar - a great place to chill out.

Reviews.Title: “OK city hotel”
Reviews.Author: sammidford
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to an executive room, which was worthwhile. Although I didn't think it up to 4* for the room (the decor was a bit tired in the bathroom). The staff were really helpful and friendly and the rooms were well stocked with towels etc and clean. It was noisy outside but I suppose it's to be expected (if the windows were double glazed it would be perfectly quiet, I'm sure)

Reviews.Title: “Very bad exeperience”
Reviews.Author: ylod
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to have a none smoking room ( confirmed twice, once by the reservation and the reception), the room was smoking and smelly. I mentioned to the recetpion, they say that they can change my room the next day ( I was staying one night, indeed the front office did not chekc into the system), I insisted and the gentlemen talked to his colleague without to put me in hold....so I heard all teh conversation ( he called mi : La 702..it was my room number). No phone number for the room service in the room, obliged to call the reception 3 times and they conected me to somewhere and the person who pick up the phone did nt even mentioned the deaprtment. the room service was served in 15 minutes but in one plastic tray put in the bed... breakfast was ok....and the check out quick

Reviews.Title: “Good average hotel, friendly staff, great views from roof terrace.”
Reviews.Author: djh2205
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Expo for one week in May. it is very close to Sants Train Station and the metro. A taxi from the airport cost just under 30 Euro. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Our only complaint was that the rooms were a bit small for the price, and although we did have a balcony, our views were of the train station and the huge hotel next door! The breakfasts were very good, with something for everyone. The rooms were nice and clean, they had air con and a good shower. The roof top bar and pool area has amazing views up to Montjuic and the surrounding area. You can also see the spires of The Sagrada Familia in the distance. There is a lovely park round the corner, and a supermarket next door. It was an approx 15 minute metro trip (with one change) to the beach and most other major tourist attractions. The hop on hop off bus is round the corner outside Sants Station. The hotel is a 10 minute walk to a huge shopping centre and there is a really good restaurant across the road called Roma - definitely worth a try!

Reviews.Title: “Handily placed basic hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Brixtonesque
Reviews.Content: Once I got over my frustration that the Barcelona Sants information desk staff had guided me half a mile to the wrong direction (beware that carrer Mallorca starts right at the station, not over the big junction!), I was rather pleased with the location of this hotel: right outside the Sants station but also within a 5-minute walk to the Tarragona metro stop. The communal areas of the hotel are nicer than the rather plain (but functional) bedrooms. Our Executive bedroom had a small balcony but without any furniture, so it was useless in the end. Sound proofing in the bedrooms wasn't great, we could hear doors banging and people talking next door. The rooftop has a sunny pool bar, which is open 11am - 5pm in the summer months. We didn't have breakfast or other meals at the hotel; there are so many nicer places in town for that purpose. There is a small supermarket, a souvenir shop and several cashpoints right next to the hotel, but the area is otherwise not interesting. The best thing about the hotel was easily its staff, who were all very friendly and helpful and spoke good English (like, surprisingly to us, everyone in Barcelona).

Reviews.Title: “I am happy that my hotel was EXPO Hotel Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: belarus2030
Reviews.Content: 3 min from rail station and metro, good room and service.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment...don't expect it to look like the pictures!”
Reviews.Author: Kajohn1011
Reviews.Content: Arrived expecting an executive suite, like the one we paid for and the one in the picture. instead got a room without a mattress pad, cheap bedspread, no artwork...just bland scraped up walls. The place had been redone but so cheaply that it would be equivalent to a motel in the states. At 156 euros a night or over $200 a night , that's not what we bargained for. Everything was an add on...Internet, breakfast and even the expresso machine....1.20 euros. We spent twelve days in Spain and Portugal. And have travelled extensively but have never been quite so disappointed . The clerk at the counter responded when I asked if there were any rooms like the one in the picture by saying they needed to change the picture....she wouldn't agree to false advertising however. There are a lot of hotels in Barcelona....find another one!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: pereine
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed there from 29th of april until 2nd of may 2011, and we really had a great time at this hotel. The staff was exstremely nice, helpful and polite. We also got a lot of help from the hotel before we went to Barcelona through contact per mail with the hotel. Everything by the hotel was nice, clean and tidy and breakfast was just perfect!! It was also very easy to get to central parts of the city, because the underground was only a few metres from the hotel, and railwaystation which took you to and from aeroport was only a 100 metres away. I really can't say enough nice things about the staff, they were the best I've ever experienced on all my travels.

Reviews.Title: “Very good base, clean, friendly”
Reviews.Author: Robbo23
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my GF for three nights this month, it's literally on the doorstep of the Sants train station, which makes it excellent for getting on the metro and discovering Barcelona. It's also very very easy to travel from the airport directly to Sants. When we arrived we were allocated a room, when we arrived at the room it was not ready, the chambermaid called the reception and sent us back downstairs, the reception apologised an upgraded us to an executive room for their error. We were on the 8th floor and had excellent views from a large balcony. The only downside is the noise of the traffic, if you're a light sleeper then take ear plugs! air conditioning in our room was great. The park just outside the hotel is really nice, it has plenty of places to sit and relax, basketball courts and locals playing tennis. The Hotel is next to a supermarket also, so anyone on a budget can stock up on food! On the 10th floor (the roof) is the bar and pool, the pool closed quite early (5pm) but there are sun loungers situated near the bar you could stay until 1am if you so wished!! 3rd Floor was the indoor bar, really nice modern decor, very friendly courteous staff. We didn't eat at the hotel, so cannot comment on food. The restaurant did look nice however. In a nutshell, it's extremely easy to get to the hotel from the airport, it's ideal as a base for exploring Barcelona, it's clean and in a safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and modern with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ellie_jane04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over the Easter weekend, for 4 nights. When booking a hotel, we found many cheaper options to be full so we were just glad to find somewhere with a room! We arrived at the hotel and we had been given a complimentary upgrade to a 'Superior' room, which was very spacious with AC, TV (no Sky) and a small balcony. The room was comfortable and quiet with a nice bathroom, all very clean. The service at the hotel was excellent, from the front desk to the bar/restaurant. We paid for breakfast one morning, which was one of the best hotel breakfasts I've seen - a vast choice of hot and cold food for EUR9,95 per person. We also ate in the restaurant one evening, which was OK, but I'd recommend eating elsewhere. The hotel was within 5 mins of a couple of metro stations and close to Parc Joan Miro, Espanya and Parc Montjuic. We were also offered free Wi-Fi during our stay, which was great!

Reviews.Title: “Bloody great and very very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Stavrosnicola
Reviews.Content: Really good location. Close to mainline and metro. When I say close I mean 2 min strole. All the staff are friendly and catered for all our needs. To be honest if your staying in Barcelona you will never spend time in the hotel as it's such a great city to explore. But the hotel in my eyes ticked every single box and would 100% return. Thank you expo for having us :-)

Reviews.Title: “Not good for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: lesmec
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from spending 4 nights at this hotel. The booking was for my birthday and was a surprise by my boyfriend. It was billed as a 4 star hotel, but I would only put this down as a 3 star. We booked a standard double (through a ‘secret room’), however when we arrived we were informed there are only 4 standard doubles in the whole hotel and that by booking a double it is only a ‘request’ and that you will be provided with a room for 2 people. So the romantic time away was spoiled by this. We were moved to a double room halfway through the stay and were told it was an executive room. However, I have stayed in many hotels for work and this was a 3 star hotel room, the only difference for the executive is that we had a dressing gown and a razor set. Not worth it! The rooms however, were both quite spacious with a fairly large bathroom. There were separate walk-in wardrobes which had a safe (but you had to pay 3 Euros a day for it). The rooms however are quite noisy, partially due to the location (right by the main train station) and also due to the tiled floors and thin walls and ceilings. The location is convenient right by the main train station and also close to Tarragona metro stop. You can get there directly from the airport, so saves having to drag your bags around lots of back streets. The breakfast was large and plentiful. However, did have an issue getting a clean table and plates each day. This was included in our price (due to the bedroom issues), but would have cost 9 Euros each, which was not worth it as could have got better from the café’s. We attempted to go to the swimming pool which is on the roof, but it was more like a large paddling pool, with the edging tiles all broken and cracked (not very pleasant or safe). There was a nice terrace bar on the roof as well, but be warned that we were on the 9th floor and you can hear the bar if your under it. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. Overall, I would come back to Barcelona but not stay here again. Pro’s * Location – transport links * Room size Con’s * Not enough doubles * Noisy * Not a 4 star

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: passionfruitsin
Reviews.Content: on route to Sao Paulo for Singapore, i decided to break at Barcelona for 2 days. i booked the Expo in advance and 2 days before I arrived, guest relations at Expo Hotel cue me about my booking. I arrived early mroning of March 26 and they check me in immediately as room was avilable. The reception staff were helpful and courteous and we were welcome with a drink. we even received a welcome package from Paula who runs the front office in which information on Barcelona and how toi get about was provided. we are very satisfied with our stay and would recommend Expo to everyone considering Barcelona as a destination. only one blemish. there is this refuse truck that comes around early in the morning to clear trash and they do create a dim. hope the hotel can rearrange with the trash company to do this at other time of the day.

Reviews.Title: “No Air- Con”
Reviews.Author: pennymike66
Reviews.Content: Great location, Friendly staff, The room was satisfactory, but not non smoking as requested. But there was no AC and as it was in mid 20's very warm for April and the room was very hot I would not like to be staying there in the summer.,

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location, bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: John660
Reviews.Content: Really superb rooms for the price, it felt like a much fancier hotel than the price indicated. Overall excellent value, our only complaint would be that the rooms weren't all that soundproof, but thankfully we had earplugs with us. Easy to find, we walked out of Sants train station and voila, there was the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “excellent, hospitality and the perfect hotel to stay....”
Reviews.Author: rams517
Reviews.Content: This is the best place to stay if you are going to run the marathon. The main train station is right opposite the hotel, very easy to reach from the airport....safe location if travelling with kids...I travelled alone for the first time to Barcelona...the rooms were spacious, neat.....restaurants serve great food...They accomodated my special needs graciously...in one word...for the price...BEST HOTEL... ps: again if you are attending for the marathon, take the marathon package...great food....didnt have to worry abt a thing...5min walk to the start point... rr

Reviews.Title: “Good location and excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: wilsonjing
Reviews.Content: Downstair is supermarket which is good. Staff explain a lot for location and service.

Reviews.Title: “A great value with a great location”
Reviews.Author: jlessuck
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a fantastic value. I spent 356 euros (about 450 dollars) for 7 nights including VAT. The hotel was modern, clean and very well run. The staff responded quickly to 2 minor problems I had with my tv. The room was SMALL (I got a single and it is) but the only real complaints I have are that there was no place to put a weeks worth of clothes, and the bed was a little hard, although that is better than too soft. The hotel is literally 50m from the Sants Station, and had 4 restaurants across the street, and a major supermarket downstairs. There is also a pharmacy around the corner and 2 inexpensive internet shop within 3 blocks (1 euro/hr as opposed to 5 times that in the hotel). The hotel is a 5 min. walk for Plaza Espana and a 10 min walk from the Mercat Hostafranks which is great if you want to pick up good cheap food for lunch. Overall, this was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “unbelievable! everything is unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: redhero77
Reviews.Content: the value this hotel gives is out of this world.its in a great location.train,metro,tourist hop on hop off bus all at your doorstep.the price too is great.we upgraded to a bigger room when we booked online,its advisable cause the regular rooms are small but you don't go to barcelona to stay in the room.for the price you get a truly world class city hotel.we didn't eat in the hotel cause we were only there 2 nights so we ate out.there's a hypermarket down next to the hotel.6 heineken for 3euro!heaven!ha ha.Paula/paola is a lovely woman too.she's the receptionist,perfect english and she'll give you loads of vouchers-as many as you want for money off everything in barcelona.great hotel,great city.because it was February the night life wasn't as good but we went to post Olympico to a bar called the australian.large beer and a massive I mean massive vodka and orange for 7euro.happy days.5am it finishes at but I'd say in the summer the night life would be more lively but still good.the highlight though was park guell,very relaxed beautiful park looking over the city.nou camp brilliant.sagrada familia,brilliant!all in all barcelona plus expo hotel equals happy times!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,mix up with rooms.”
Reviews.Author: artic
Reviews.Content: Myself,my fiancée and another couple stayed in this hotel for 7 days,for the first 3 days we were given rooms with twin beds instead of doubles (which we had booked in the first place),after the third day of going to reception and asking to be changed to what we had booked we got fed up and nearly had to argue to be changed..in the end they gave us double rooms,but were told that they were upgrades and pretty much made out that they were doing us a favor!! other than that the stay was good,the hotel was clean,if somewhat basic,the location was pretty good,tube stop just around the corner made it handy to go pretty much where ever we wanted in the city,a supermarket just around the corner also and a few bars and restaurants,but they were not up to much.The roof of the hotel was brilliant though,lovely pool and big lounging area and bar(where we spent most of our nights before the clubs).The breakfast was ok,a good selection and as much as you wanted as it was a buffet.I would stay in this hotel again but if i do i will insist the moment i arrive that i want the room i booked!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location but good value for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: woollysheep
Reviews.Content: Our first impressions of the hotel were slightly disappointed from the quietness of the location. However, after getting to know the area, it is in an ideal spot. We were smack in the middle between 2 convenient metro stations, only 20 mins from the airport and 5-10 minutes into the city centre. The hotel itself was very clean and welcoming. The rooms were smaller than anticipated, the room could do with updating and the beds not very comfy. We did have some problems with the ventilation as the rooms were very stuffy, but overall the hotel was suitable. There were nearby restaurants and coffee shops if you didn't want to pay for the hotel breakfast, which was delicious when we did try it. There was a good moroccan and italian restaurant more or less opposite the hotel and a supermarket next door which was very handy for snacks and packed lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexPuente
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel at a very good price.. Good location next to the main train station of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good short break base”
Reviews.Author: teddytnorwich
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a short break following a cruise that ended in Barcelona. We chose the hotel for it's proximity to Sants station and the easy journey from there to the airport. This is a good 4 star hotel with above average size rooms for a city centre hotel. Bedroom facilities were good and included balcony overlooking the square in front of the station. Buffet breakfast was excellent, good choice of hot and cold items, good fruit, juices etc. Reception were very friendly and helpful, no problem in holding luggage for several hours on our last day. The area, while a little away from the main action around La Rambla has it's own vibe with plenty of small bars and restaurants and is seen as up and coming, there are also excellent metro links to the rest of the city if walking is not your thing.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel with a nice pool on the roof”
Reviews.Author: everythingcounts
Reviews.Content: Barcelona was our last stop in our Europe trip and we had some nice hotels during our way down to Spain. We had high expectations because the hotel had 4 stars and a pool on the roof. When we checked in they made clear that we will have two different beds. We’re a couple, so we thought that we were given a double bed. They said that for an extra payment we could get a double bed. We said no, and during our stay we heard the staff saying this to more couples. Seemed like a part of their strategy to make more money. The room had a nice balcony, two beds, TV, and a fresh bathroom. We also had a mini bar and a desk. The hotel was close to the main train station, as well as it was close to the subway. Restaurants and grocery stores were close also. The pool was very nice, and sometimes a bit crowded. But it was nice to go up on the roof to catch some sun and take a cool swim, though the pool was small. Right under they had a bar, were they also served some food. Another thing that took it all down was the AC. We needed the cool room, because Barcelona in August is very hot. The AC was leaking as fast as it got a little bit cold, and the floor got soaked. The last day we complained and the offered us a free breakfast as compensation. No talk about it, the breakfast was great! I would stay at the hotel again, because over all we liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and well connected by road and rail”
Reviews.Author: Naveen13
Reviews.Content: Excellent 4 star hotel that is in close vicinity of the train station as well as the bus station. The bus station was quite handy for us as me and my wife were able to get on to the Hop On and Hop Off Tour Bus that took us around the entire countryside. Barcelona is simply magnificent and our stay at the Hotel was also quite memorable. Rooms are quite spaced out, has all the normal amenities, lovely pool on the terrace are which also doubles up as the bar counter in the night and the prices are quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, but dont expect much”
Reviews.Author: tmblweed
Reviews.Content: On the upside, the staff was pleasant and responsive; the dining area is beautifully and impressively designed; breakfast has a wonderful selection that includes local goodies like churros and freshly squeezed orange juice. The hotel is really near a metro station; its a few minutes away from some fabulous sites in the direction of Montjuic; and theres a handy little grocery with reasonably priced goods beside the hotel. The downside---the hotel lobby is super tiny; the rooms were small and the carpet was old and dirty; the airconditioning was down for autumn and winter so we were told to open the glass doors of the terrace for cool air but we could hear conversations of people on the street and early morning garbage collection; walls are so thin, we could cary a conversation with the neighbor next door through the wall. It may not deserve a 4 star rating but I'd still recommend the hotel with a word of caution to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “I thought this hotel was brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: RojBlake
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the train at Barcelona Sants station and this hotel was easily spotted a short distance away. Location is everything, and with a hypoermarket next door, and some excellent cafes and restaurants across the street, this one couldn;t be faulted, provided you wanted to be away from the centre of Barcelona but near to the excellent metro system. After a quick and friendly check in, we were given vouchers for a free drink each and directed to our executive room on the top floor. The room was huge, tastefully furnished with plenty of storage space and a lovely litle balcony which had a great view across the city. We found no problems with the large bathroom, no moulod smells or other issues at all. We wnt to the bar and found the same excellent and friendly service there as in reception. The beer was excellent and very reasonably priced compared to the other establishments nearby. The only slight criticism I would make is that the seats seem more designed to be trendy than comfortable! Other reviewers have mentioned a smell of sewerage. At one point in the corrdior on the 9th floor, there was a faint smell, bu tthe same odour was also present outside in one of the main streets. I assume that ther eis some sort of problem with the draisn at that particular point, whcih appears to be outside the control of the hotel. I did not notice any unpleasant smell int eh room itself, or in the public areas of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No good idea to upgrade from standard to executive”
Reviews.Author: lars_gustaf
Reviews.Content: Several weeks in advance we asked for and promised a silent room with twin beds on the fouth floor and get a noisy room(traffic) with double bed on the fifth floor! The condition to have our wishes fulfilled we were recommended to upgrade the room to an executive one with an extra charge of 8,65 euro per night. So, it's to no use to upgrade the room, especially as the couple accompanied us and staying in a standard room got all what we had asked for without any requirements in beforhand. What is more is that the not working air conditioner began to burn so we had to rapidly escape from the room...But then we received an excuse and a free bottle of water

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for 3*, not worth 4*”
Reviews.Author: MEW18
Reviews.Content: A 'no frills' hotel. Needs a good clean to remove the mould and urine smell in the bathroom. Air con turned off leading to stiffling hot room-windows open onto busy road so not really am option. Sound carries clearly from room to room and from the corridor, lift lobby etc making for disturbed nights. If you are looking for a hotel convenient for the metro and don't want to sleep much, this may be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rate, good location - but not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: mike04021949
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 250 yards from the main railway station - Sants - which has a 20 minute connection to the airport. It's also only a couple of stops on the metro to Les Corts which serves the Camp Nou - home of FC Barcelona. The entrance is through a large revolving door and the reception is immediately on the right. It was the middle of Saturday afternoon when I arrived and busy but, with three staff checking in, I was done and dusted in about 6-7 minutes. I'd upgraded my room in advance to an Executive room for an extra EU17 so the total per night was EU93 including breakfast (American). The room has plenty of clothing storage space, a large double bed, a balcony staring across to apartments opposite but, as I was on the 8th floor, I had a great view across the city. The bathroom had all the usual items but, for me, the bath was a bit short. As I'd booked online, I was also awarded free Wi-fi but I didn't take my laptop. A free bowl of fruit also arrived later that evening. The restaurant/bar is open plan on the 3rd floor (there's also a function/meeting area) and serv es food/drink from 11.00am till about midnight. I had a club sandwich which was a huge chicken salad taosted sandwich with, for me, a massive portion of fries! With a beer, it came to about EU9. The hotel calls itself a 4 star. In truth it's probably better than three star - but 4 star? Not sure. However, I'd happily revisit because the staff sim ply can't do enough for you!! Oh, and there's an open air pool on the 9th floor roof with a bar alongside.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Ronniec78
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed here for 3 nights and we really enjoyed it. The lobby and dining area here are very trendy but the rooms are basic. We had a balcony overlooking some of the city which was nice. Breakfast was included in our stay and it was quite good and the selection is huge. I wouldn't say the location is great but it's not bad either. We cabbed it to all the restaurants we went to downtown which cost about 6-7 euro's each way. The service here was great which I was pleased with. The front desk staff was very helpful and responded to requests promptly and professionally. I would definitely stay here again but if I come to Barcelona again I may opt for a closer location to the downtown area. Oh yeah another thing I like about this place is that they give you 15 minutes of free Wi-Fi use. I was charged everywhere else I stayed in Europe. 15 minutes was more than enough time to check my e-mails.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Barcelona base”
Reviews.Author: MJM345
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Expo Hotel. 100 yds from Main Station, so ideal for getting to and from the airport. Metro and buses easy to use and quick to get to all the main attractions.
