Walking distance of Placa D'Espanya (trains to Montserrat), the Magic Fountain ( a must visit evening attraction) and Montjuic. Supurb Hotel Breakfasts and brunches up to 1:00 a.m. (useful when arriving late and hungry), however the former being a bit pricey if not on B&B basis. The cafe in the Hypermarket next door does cheap, good, toasted baguettes in the morning - ideal as a filling starter for the day. Excellent roof patio and sunbeds (in season - April - September ?? - and nice small, deep pool to chill out in. Rooftop terrace/bar open till 1:00 a.m., with views to Montjuic. Although the weather is cooler, go around September 23 every year, (close to this date), when Barcelona holds its largest street party, a 4 day celebration of hundreds of events going on all around the city, all day, at many venues, ending each night with several huge pop/rock concerts going on till the early hours, and the festival culminating with an unmissable finale firework show on the last night (10:00 p.m.) at the Magic Fountain. The Barcelona La Merce Festival. Print an English version program before you go. Day 1 procession in the Ramblas. Best locations are Monjuic Hill, Ciutadella park and Plaça de Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not four star”
Reviews.Author: Belgo43
Reviews.Content: Good location near railway station and metro, OK service and clean but very small rooms (mine was an "executive" room but there was nothing executive about it and only shower not bath). My bathroom flooded whenever the shower was used due to bad drainage. Breakfast was OK, but often it's hard to get seated, and once we waited 5 minutes for plates to arrive. Stylish design but in need of refreshment. Whether you should stay here depends on the price you get. I don't know how it got four stars (OK, three at a push but not four).

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the standard rooms”
Reviews.Author: Wizard_snaps
Reviews.Content: After a long journey and very a pleasant receptionist we let our selves into the room we had booked. The room was bare with 'artex' on the wall and smelled like a care home. This was two star accommodation ans we felt a little ripped off. Upgrades weren't available for the first night but we payed 8 euro's per night to upgrade for the next two nights, which was worth it. The room had a balcony and we watched a wonderful firework display over at Montjuic from the roof bar. Breakfast was good, and there were plenty of quiet places to sit. The location was good, a few minutes from the main station (Sants) where the train for the airport left from. A good metro station was 5 minutes walk away. Overall a generally clean hotel with generally pleasant staff. Avid the standard rooms at all cost. Good location for transport and seeing the city. Montjuic was a 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing ... 4 stars they have to be kidding!”
Reviews.Author: allowishis
Reviews.Content: Ignored by 4 receptionists for 10 mins at check in. Once we eventually got keys they gave us the wrong room twin instead of the executive double with city views we booked although (this room had city views, was clean and spacious). After finally getting the room sorted we were given another room. 4 star it was not unless cheap furniture, poor conditioned room and dirty bathrooms with mould on the bathroom ceiling is standard. My city views turned out to be seeing into an elderly ladies flat accross the street. On a better note the breakfast offered a good selection but would have been better if the appropriate food would have been kept warm. Altogether not a satisfactory experience. I would avoid this hotel unless you wish to pay good money to slum it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: TamraBxl
Reviews.Content: I staid a week with my boyfriend in this hotel. The lobby and the restaurant were beatifull, the staff was really friendly and the breakfast was worth the money. There was even Cava at the breakfast. The location was good. There was a subway station at 200m from the hotel, that brings you in 20 minutes to the city center. The central train station is 500meters away, that trains brings you in 30 minutes to Sitges for a day at the beach or a daytrip to Codurnio were all the Cava houses are. The only weak point in this hotel was the room. The room needed to be refurnished, now it looked a bit dingy. There was also a lot of internal noice in the rooms. Next to our room there were young people that held parties just until 1 o'clock in the morning. In the elevator we saw pictures from renovated rooms and they looked nice. We ordered once food at night with the room service and it was really good. There is a nice swimming pool at the roof. Not large but ok.

Reviews.Title: “Did the people who wrote bad reviews stay at another hotel?”
Reviews.Author: lilboops
Reviews.Content: I don't get the bad reviews of this hotel. I booked Expo through a discount online site. I paid a very low rate for an executive suite (less than $80 US per night), and have gotten WAY more than I paid for. The hotel is in a good location, near the Sants train station and two metro stations. Cabs line the front street, so if taking the train isn't your pleasure, you have this option. The staff here are wonderful. I was able to check-in at 7:30 am following my flight. The restaurant and lounges are clean and well staffed. The food, especially the buffet breakfast is very good. There are four restaurants right across the street from the hotel, and 20 others (yes, 20) within a 10 minute walk. The people saying there is no where convenient to eat around the hotel must have not left their room (and even if that is the case, the hotel has room service!). I still have a few more days in the hotel, but I cannot forsee and issues. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “not a four star hotel...”
Reviews.Author: gosee00
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a four star hotel, unless you pay extra for an upgrade on arrival. Without the upgrade the rooms are two star maximum. The pool is not clean and there are no sunscreens on the roof. The general feeling of the hotel is a that it is a decent three-star (if you get the upgrade) hotel suited for families or travellers looking for a mid range hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ianz900
Reviews.Content: Cant understand the review which say there is no where to eat? I counted four restaurants on the other side of the road to the Hotel! I eat at one and it was very good meal. If you walk a little bit down the road there are more??? The Hotel is in a good potion close to Train station and metro so if you want to go to centre of town no issue 1.40 Euro single ticket and 3 Euros to Airport! As for the noise I did not notice any major issue yes there is a bit of noise from the road and some from other rooms but that is normal for Hotels? Inside the Hotel it is clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. The only downside was that the pool closes at 17.00! which I think is a bit early as if you are working and fancy a swim it will be closed. This is only between September-May later in the summer. Would I stay there again yes? Yes good Hotel and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo_A
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good but you have to know that at the end of august there is a week of festivals at the sancts neighborhood near the hotel. every night rock concerts until 2 am. The rooms dont have any carpets so every movement at the room over yours make a hard noise. if you neeed an hotel near the train and metro station so take it ( but take with you earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “would never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: gem2812
Reviews.Content: Well .... after reading other reviews I honestly don't know how anyone could say they would stay here again. Myself and my boyfriend are just back from a 5-night stay in Barcelona and if I were to go back I certainly would not stay in this hotel again! Although it is near the Barcelona Sants train station, and also a metro station (which I admit was handy), the hotel is not in a very exciting neighbourhood. Myself and my boyfriend wasted a good few hours every night just trying to find decent places to eat ... and ended up having to buy rolls and cheese from the supermarket and just eat in our room! Our room was on the 9th floor which is just underneath the roof terrace/pool etc. We had sleepless nights due to the noise of tables being dragged about on the roof, the cleaners are really noisy, and also there is an bar or nightclub along the road which plays REALLY loud music after midnight and it was awful. Overall, I feel that this hotel does not deserve 4-star. Even although it is a very minor thing, we were not even provided with a kettle or anything in the room which I thought was pretty poor. The staff were not friendly or in the least bit helpful - when leaving for the airport we asked if they could arrange with a taxi driver to take us (as we did not speak spanish) and they refused. I wish I had read more reviews before going, but I definately would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller201000
Reviews.Content: The location of the Expo Hotel is fantastic, as it's within 5 minutes walk to two different metro stations, as well as Barcelo Sants - a large international station, which connects you to the airport. It wasn't quite as close to the city centre as we had assumed (actually about 45 - 50 minute walk to Las Ramblas), but it's incredibly easy to reach the city centre by metro, and taxis proved to be very reasonably priced. I went with my boyfriend, and we were probably two of the youngest people in the hotel, both being under 20, and we were travelling on a moderate budget. We booked the hotel as part of a package, and found ourselves with an executive room - seemed to be a good move as these aren't much more expensive but were really comfortable. The hotel staff were very helpful - we asked them for so many recommendations and directions, and they were always happy to help. The roof-top terrace, with a bar, 'chill-out zone' and swimming pool was a great place to relax, too. The hotel itself is very modern, clean and stylish, if a little lacking in character. Our only complaints were that the hotel cleaners woke us up every morning when cleaning the rooms on either side of ours. Also, any food and drink bought within the hotel is very over priced, and there doesn't seem to be a proper dinner menu. We would definately recommend this one, although wouldn't necessarily stay here again as we would like to be within walking distance of the city's amazing nightlife in future!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great all rounder, decent staff”
Reviews.Author: barneycollie
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 days here, also stayed here last year. Hotel quite clean, room serviced every day, staff efficient. Very handy for arriving at Sants station from the airport, only two minutes walk away. If using metro to go anywhere advise using Tarragona metro station, its not as far as the Sants station platform, turn left out of hotel then right for a few hundred yards to entrance. Make sure you buy a T10 metro ticket to save money, available at all stations including entrance to airport station. Great pool and chill out area on top floor, towels provided free by the pool attendant. Breakfast had fantastic selection although they kept running out of plates which was a bit annoying. Salt and pepper pots could be more freely available. Hotel is a bit noisy at times, it all depends on who is in the rooms next to you, luck of the draw I suppose. Overall only good comments but always check out internet prices as well as booking direct with hotel as they have a guarantee to beat any other price by 10%. I saved over £107 for the week , not bad for a few emails between their sales staff and myself.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Good Facilities”
Reviews.Author: cheapies
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with the family after a break around Catalunya. I dont like Barca because of how busy it is and always tend to avoid it. However the flight from BCN was early so I needed to stay there to catch the early flight. £70 for one night in a family room with breakfast included. Alpharooms Choice of this hotel was easy as it was right next to Sants Station and the train shuttle. In terms of its location around Barca, its not the best but the Metro is so good you can be anywhere in the city in minutes . Enough going on around the hotel couple of bars and nice restaurants. The hotel itself was nice, pool and terrace on the roof was very good for the kids, however as is usually the case the food and bar prices were excessive so there was no incentive to eat or drink in the hotel. Check in was good, easy and hassle free. Room was not up to usual 4* standards, adequate but nothing special. High cost of WIFI was not good for a "business hotel" Breakfast 6am start was very useful, the standard was very high for hotel breakfasts. I would recommend this hotel, especially if you get it for the price i paid

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay by two ladies from UK”
Reviews.Author: prettygirl205
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the hotel was good overal. Some particular Staff were very helpful with everything ( can't name names due to confidentiality) and changed our room on the second night when we complained of the noise. Bad thing was the noise in the morning, beds being moved and there was no carpet. Breakfast was brilliant. BUT hated the fact that they charge 2 euros for 15mins of surfing internet. I still haven't come to terms with it. Would definately recommend it to anyone. Like I told ma friend you can't have everything!!!

Reviews.Title: “spot on, great room,convenient location, helpful staff with awesome breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ctlcork
Reviews.Content: We arrived late which was no problem at check in, smooth process,able to check into our room,drop off our bags, balcony outside, a/c kept room nice and cool. enjoyed nightcaps under the stars at the pool bar.offered breakfast at discounted rate on check in which we took advantage off. Foyer, restaurant and business centre all decorated with bright cherrful colors. Convenient to Sants station for easy access to the airport and le ramblas....overall definately recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, mistrained employees”
Reviews.Author: Sergio303631
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. Excellent room, air conditioner is outstanding, the pool and the bar are useful. The location is not the best if you don´t want to take the subway. What I didn´t enjoy was the noise (we could listen to everything in the room above us AND the street is noisy too) and the service. People are sometimes rude, specially a security guard in the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: KevEls
Reviews.Content: A little out of the way and need to use metro to get around which is just over the road , no breakfast included in price, no parasols by the pool which makes it very uncomfortable in summertime , the excellent maids keep the rooms very clean ,air con. On the whole a nice hotel but would not use again. Wouild have an hotel by the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, great terraza, grand breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: case02
Reviews.Content: The Expo was a great place to stay in. The room was businesslike and clean, the Hotel staff were very helpful and the rooftop pool and terraza was excellent. I went for the 9 Euro breakfast offer which I recommend as the choice is huge and well worth it. The food on the terrace was also nice. The only qualm was that the shower leaked a bit, but that was ok! The hotel was next to Sants station which meant getting around was quite easy. I would stay here again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Looking”
Reviews.Author: MRLEGREE17
Reviews.Content: So i came to Barcelona for an academic conference (not at the hotel). I was chose the Expo because of its good location, nearby a metro and train stop, and frankly because it looked hip. And these are the ONLY two reasons you should choose this hotel. It looks great from the outside, and they have made a good effort at a showcase lounge space. But the rooms are SMALL; i got a "Junior Executive Suite", which had no discernable difference in size from a normal room. I had to be moved after a day when the A/C broke, and the only available room was on a smoking floor. If you book online you get free WiFi, but you have to ask for an access code every day of your stay and it gets annoying. Pool frequently closed. Also, when checking out, they asked for my passport, and didn't hand it back to me--admittedly i should have made sure i had it and asked for it back, so it was my fault, but didn't realize the mistake until i got to the airport, at which point i called them and they put it into a cab to the airport--good move, but maybe they should have paid, right? anyway, you choose a hotel to get good service. You choose the Expo Barcelona because you want to stay in something that looks Eurotrash and makes you feel hip. Keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy”
Reviews.Author: penkiBristol
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located for Sants station and there is a half hourly train to/from the airport that costs only 3 euro each way (in June 2010). The staff, particularly Tamara, are extemely helpful. The rooms are adequate but certainly not four star and the rooms are extremely noisy and I was woken several times in the night by something whining for several minutes each time (I tried to find out what it was and think it may have been rubbish bin emptying.

Reviews.Title: “Non smokers beware!!”
Reviews.Author: rah1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel for us was only ok!. Being a smoking hotel the corridors smell of stale cigarettes and the smoke from other rooms comes through the air-conditioning. I'm not sure the Expo Hotel quite deserved it 4 star rating just yet. Ask for an executive room, this means new bed and a more modern decor, although the bathrooms still looked a bit shabby. The public areas looked fine but the corridors could have done with a new carpet and a lick of paint. On a brighter note the staff were very good and couldn't do more for us, well done. The location, right in front of the Barcelona Sants train station could be considered convenient but I would have prefered to be nearer the town centre or in a better neighbourhood. I love Barcelona and would love to return one day but I wouldn't return to the Expo Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: sassiecat050
Reviews.Content: Immediately upon leaving Sants Estacion in Barcelona, a glance to the right and up gave us our first view of the Expo & how truly convenient the location is. The hotel had all the amenities we wanted - including easy internet access at the business center on the 3rd floor, which is also where the breakfast buffet, restaurant & bar/lounge were located. There is an additional charming bar on the roof (with an equally charming bartender, Juan, who I believe is Cuban & had the ability to treat everyone with equal charm, yet manage to make it seem as if it was genuinely reserved for you alone. Quite a valuable trait in the hospitality industry) but, alas, the weather interfered with our enjoyment of that feature. Our booking did not include a meal plan and upon check-in we inquired about breakfast & were quoted a current special of 9 euros per day. Seemed a bit pricey until the next morning - it was a feast of everything from cold cereals to hot egg dishes (several different ones each day) juices, hot beverages, several breads and rolls and an entire sideboard of pastries and as a serve yourself buffet, it was also all you could eat - very nice for the two of us who like to have a big breakfast to fortify our day of walking, walking, walking with only a small snack to tide us over until dinner.. There was ample room for everyone to not only secure a table (no matter what time we showed up), but be able to move about getting whatever you wanted without knocking into someone else's table. One cold, rainy day we stayed in for dinner, which was quite tasty - the only down side being my pork tenderloin dish having two pieces slightly overdone & one piece with a big raw spot. I like my pork pink & juicy, but not raw. Every other aspect of dinner - as well as snacks & drinks in the bar another day - was very tasty and not priced out of line for the area and season. The only down side was the floor of our room, bathroom and bathroom counter being visibly dirty/spotted and not cleaned the entire time we were there. Otherwise, everything else was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: willowinie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, and would recommend it. Tip!!Exclusive room recommended and don,t book room including breakfast, cheaper if you just go down in the morning(10euro.p.p) buffet really good! Had a a nice moroccan meal in a little restaurant across the street. Metro access close by and easy to use. Hotel is walking distance from Sants station and Hotel staff are Friendly. Bad points were; A/C didn't really work and room wasn,t ready when we arrived at 3,30pm, but these are only little things, still a nice stay CJ

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fishleter
Reviews.Content: Really like this hotel. It is the second time we have stayed there. It can be a little noisy when the cleaners are moving the beds in the rooms around yours as the feet scrape the floor but I do like the location. Its right beside Stans train station. Its not very close to Las Rambles but that is kind off what I liked. On saying that it is only a couple of stops on the metro and a lot of the time we walked it as we wanted to see more of the city. The roof top pool is lovely in the nice weather but it is a little small. The roof top bar is also nice for a cool relaxing drink after a hot day in the city. The buffet breakfast is the best I have seen in a long time, loads of hot food, salads, fruit and cake! There is also a very good supermarket within the hotel complex which was very handy for snacks or a bottle of wine. The rooms are fine for what you need. Sure they could probably do with some modernisation but the beds are very comfortable and the balcony is nice in the evening on holidays what more would you like!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holzalicious
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on the website I had mixed feelings, so I went ahead and booked. We caught the Renfe train from the airport which stopped at Sants Station which was ideal as the Expo was just across from the Station. We checked in very quick and the staff were very helpful and we were upgraded for free. I asked for a top floor which I got and was very pleased because it had lovely views of the city from our balcony. The room was very clean and comfortable. We ordered breakfast for 10 euros each and was well worth it. There was plenty to choose from including full English breakfast. The Metro station was just around the corner and was about 5 stops to Las Ramblas. We got a 5 day pass for 20 euros each and used the local transport to see all the sights which was ideal. I am glad I did"nt stay in Las Ramblas because it would have been to noisy at night.The expo Hotel in my opinion was an excellent choice and I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended unless your on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Kerjuk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK, but the rooms are looking out dated, the bar/resturant are newly decorated, looking and feeling much nicer, but the rooms are a real let down. The service is OK in the bar, but the general staff are a little akward. All in all, I will not be staying there again, I would recommend anyone to stay there, unless they are on a budget.... You get what you pay for. Remember this is a Spanish four star!

Reviews.Title: “Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: mai_orca
Reviews.Content: Overall it's a ok hotel. We stayed in the regular room and didn't see their executive room but it wasn't very nice. The room it self was pretty big but it looked worn out. For the price, we cannot complain. Good thing about the hotel was the staff were very helpful and nice. They gave us a welcome drink tickets which we could have drinks in their cute restaurant/bar in 3rd floor. We chilled out here at night. My 5 year-old liked this place.The breakfast was ok. It had plenty of choice to fill our tummy. About the hotel location; It's not the center but easy to get around. Metro station is close as well as Sants station. The neighborhood isn't very nice. One day my husband and a daughter were coming out from the metro station, young guy started talking to them and he started opening my husband's bag. When he yelled at the guy, the guy run away. Luckily nothing was stolen. I got a very good deal on their website. It was 65 euro for double room per night and breakfast included, also free wifi. I don't know if this is a 4 star hotel, but if the room was better, definitely this can be a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing more than a good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: arekwarzycha
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night so my review will be short because maybe I didnt get the best look of the hotel. Firstly, I had booked from the official site but when I arrived they didnt have my reservation. So I had to forward them my confirmation email that I got from them. Really crazy. They told me that the reservation department with the reception are two different departments. So they told me that I had (!!!) to forward the reservation to the reception. Anyways I understand there could have been a mix up. The standard room is ok (photo attached) I had a nice view because I was on the top floor. The problem is that the rooms are not very sound-proof so I had some problems with that. If you reserve your room from the official website you have free Internet otherwise it is expensive. Breakfast was very good. Room service food that I ordered also very good. The only problem is that the reception gave me one number for room service, the room had another number for room service and finally the room service number was a complete different number. Also calling from my room to the reception they didnt pick up the phone all the time which I thought was very weird.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, but woulnd't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Masik23
Reviews.Content: So I was very nervous about this hotel. I booked it because I got a fantastic rate but then read a lot of bad reviews. I contacted the hotel prior to my arrival and specifically asked about the cleanilness of the rooms and they reassured me that the rooms are very clean and that they are a top notch hotel. So when I got there, they automatically upgraded me to an executive room and had they not told me that this was an upgrade, I would have never known because the room was nothing special. I don't even want to know what the standard room looks like. the room was ok. I cannot say that it was dirty, but I wouldn't walk barefoot on the floor either. there was a strange smell everywhere in the hotel, very damp smell, not sure what it was. The lobby was great, very modern. We even had breakfast there one day which was pretty decent for 10 euro. The location was good, very close to the train station and two metro lines. Very convinient if you're taking the train from the airport, it's a straigh shoot. Very close to Plaza de Espaynya so can't complain about that. it's not a 4 star hotel at all, more like a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “lousy hotel, misleading guests”
Reviews.Author: clamg
Reviews.Content: Starting with the name-Expo Hotel. If you want to go from there to the Barcelona exibition area it takes you 45 m. Underground+train or taxi it is the same. Hotel is rated 4 stars . Totaly misleading again. Worth maybe 2 as a maximum. Apparently some rooms are renovated bu the ones they gave you look like a 1 star hotel at best. Terribly old and outfashioned. Smelling moist, bathroom decadent, everything outdated. 2 terrible beds that look like camping beds, bed light not working, room like a corridor, bed cover and curtains and terrible state, coulor fading. Lobby and breakfast room looking good, totaly misleading for the rest. They give you a sheet at recepcion with prices for upgrades (I guess that most guests don't believe where they are...) but prices in reality are higher.Internet very expoensive Everything misleading and bad quality. Don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very well located”
Reviews.Author: LunaCampinaGrande
Reviews.Content: It's a good hotel. The staff is incredible. Very well located.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad service, terrible security, and very unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: Bloom10
Reviews.Content: We had about 7 electrical items stolen from our room on our last day of stay. They seemed to know where to find the items. We were on the top floor of the hotel. The only persons entering our room were the housekeepers. Very suspicious. The hotel manager Alicia Trullen was very unhelpful and went home. Definitely would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: ry0ohki
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a pretty good value for a 4 star hotel (realistically is more like a 3 star..). The areas outside of the rooms definitely are not representative of the rooms themselves. My particular room was very dated, with the exception of an updated bathroom. But despite not being plush the rooms were clean and acceptable. The location can't be beat right by the train station and the popular green line (L3). And all rooms seem to have nice little balconies to enjoy the weather. The walls are definitely paper thin.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad privacy”
Reviews.Author: susana7Lisbon
Reviews.Content: The best of is that it is easy to reach the city center from the Hotel and it has very friendly staff. The swimming pool in the terrace is nice! The worse is the noise coming from other rooms, especially in the morning; I could swear the persons of the neighbour room were having shower in our bathroom when I woke up! Cleaning ladies also start early (8h) making lots of noise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but rooms are lacking.”
Reviews.Author: losangeles_jetsetter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and absolutely loved the location. It can't get much better than this if you're a public transportation kind of traveler like me. The staff was friendly and helpful. I received a free drink coupon at check in to be redeemed on their rooftop bar which was quite fun. Unfortunately the rooms aren't as great as they could be. They are very basic and everything feels really cheap. Even the bed spread is a thin blanket. The highlight of the room is the balcony although I felt a litle strange because my room faced an apartment building and I felt like the people across might be able to see into my room. I didn't eat at their restaurant but don't really regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic! Cockroaches in the bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTraveller28
Reviews.Content: Beware of this hotel because the standard of the rooms depends on which floor you're staying on. Some floors have been renovated while others are more like studios on the Greek islands. Our bedroom was very basic with tiled floors and the sofa was as hard as rocks because it was actually a sofa bed. If you're staying at the back of the hotel you will be woken by industrial fans every morning at 5am. The bathroom was primitive with a horrible greasy shower curtain, all of the suite was cracked and each morning we woke to cockroaches in the bath tub which wasn't so pleasant. The beds aren't comfortable, the furniture and furnishings are very shabby, bed linen was torn etc. It was really just like staying in a studio on the Greek Islands, very very basic. However location wise, it's right outside the Sants station but far from all of the sights in Barcelona. It's about 1 hour commute by metro from the beachs of Barcelona. The swimming pool was fine, not very clean though.

Reviews.Title: “A great location close to the underground”
Reviews.Author: ajo123
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for the roof-top pool. The pool is small but adequate for a quick dip. Location worked out really well as it was really close to the main train station, Estacio Sants and the metro. Walking distance to the Art museum if you are fit and it's not too hot. We stayed for a week , mornings spent soaking up the sun and the afternoons sightseeing. The teenagers were let loose shopping in the centre of the city and found it great! Good food mostly- easy to find veggie meals.

Reviews.Title: “Next to train station and aiport express”
Reviews.Author: papasantky
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this hotel for one reason, it is next to train station and the airport express. So that was very convenient and rate was good. You will spend 5min from hotel to platform if you know the way. Hotel rooms are small and a bit tired. They have redone the lobby and several executive rooms which all guests are offered to upgrade to for about EUR 10. There is a swimming pool on the rooftop which is pretty cool as well. Be aware that area down Tarragona and Paral-lel on the west side are not the best neighborhoods, so do consider metro or taxi if you are going down to eg Plaza Espana or Montjuic in the evening. There is a large supermarket in the same building as the hotel which is very convenient to pick up some juice etc for breakfast and some spanish ham and sausages etc for souvenirs back home. Location was perfect for us and would stay again if had early flight.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with superb staff”
Reviews.Author: kathybeeMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 9am & not a problem with early check in. Clean, neat, spacious rooms with fantastic buffet breakfast. Nothing too hard for the staff. Would recommend & stay again. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for short visit, easy to find.”
Reviews.Author: HampshireJudy
Reviews.Content: Jump on the train from the airport get off at Sants station, bear right out of the station with your wheelie bag, cross the road and you are there. Stayed there twice once before a cruise and once after, upgraded the room, for another 6 euros offered at reception, well worth it. Buffet was great, huge selection about 20 euros per person, but big selection of hot food, salads, and sweets. Staff were lovely, very helpful with advice on directions to visit all the tourist attractions. Loved it. Rooms were quiet as it had a second door to close off any corridor noise, didn't hear a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location. Can be very noisy.”
Reviews.Author: archie1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a conference. Chosen it mainly for its location and 4 star rating. Location is great - next to main train/metro station (Station Sants): very convenient for travel/sightseeing. Rooms & service were reasonable but a bit below what I would expect from a 4 star hotel, but certainly 3+ rating. The main disadvantage is that it can be VERY NOISY. Around the corner, in front of Station Sants is a square where a concert can go on until early hours of the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great place, VERY noisy and swimming pool VERY small !”
Reviews.Author: bill_250
Reviews.Content: definitely not a 4* hotel !! Max a 3* The hotel is EXTREMELY noisy -- noise is coming from inside and outside ! (when we stayed there was a concert outside until 4pm every nights !!!) Location is ok (close to airport & station & congress center) The rooms are really basics too. I wouldn't recommend staying there, there are other place in BCN that are much better than this one

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AGall58
Reviews.Content: Very handy, only seconds away from the main Sants railway station. The foyer has been updated and gives the impression the rooms are likewise they are not. They are a bit old especially the bathrooms but they are clean and if you can upgrade to an executive room (R829) on the 8th floor views of the Art Museum are spectacular. Pool picture of the hotel flatters. However huge buffet breakfast at 9 Euros is great value sets you up for a day sightseeing.Staff at the desk are very welcoming and helpful. City is a bit of a walk but you go along some lovley streets on the way to the centre. Not a romatic break hotel but otherwise good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location by station from airport - lousy pool, tired rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Lorks
Reviews.Content: The Expo is in a brilliant location if you are coming / going via the main El Prat airport: The airport train stops at Sants station on the way to the city centre, and this hotel pretty much directly over looks the station itself, which also has metro connections to most of Barcelona. However the location isn't that brilliant if you want late night bars and restaurants: there are a few around the area, but it's more of a train ride than a walk to the city centre and most of the action. Just the other side of the hotel is the stop for the tourist bus, which we found to be a great way to see Barcelona in one day, even if it was pricey, at 21 Euro each. The Expo itself was obviously once a very good 4 star hotel, but its now a bit run down, with cracked tiles everywhere, and mould in the bathroom. On checking in we were offered and upgrade - for 12 euro a nit - to an executive room, which I declined, but they then gave me the upgrade anyway, as they'd run out of normal rooms with double beds: the clue here seems to be always to ask for a double to get an upgrade. The executive rooms are newer, and larger, with a balcony overlooking the station. In the room itself, the TV didn't work, and despite asking the hotel for help, it was never fixed, and only gave 2 channels. There is a Minibar but no kettle or cups. On the third floor there is a business centre, with Internet a pricey 2 euro for 15 minutes, and a pleasant if rather dull Bar, with Damn beer on tap, and at the far end a normally pretty deserted Restaurant which has a buffet at 22 euro per person: pricey, but with excellent all-you-can-eat food. On the 9th floor there is another (very small) bar, which does bar snacks, and on the 10th floor is the pool, which has to be the worst feature of the hotel. It is very run down, with lots of chipped tiles, and tiny. However, because the hotel has little going on around it, I always found the pool packed. On the whole I enjoyed my stay here, but I'd hesitate to stay again unless I need somewhere I can get to the airport very easily.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikesm
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel within walking distance of Sants Railway Station for easy quick access to the Airport. Around the corner is the Tarragona Metro Station as the tourist areas like La Rambla are over half an hour walk away - buy the T-10 travel ticket for cheaper travel. The magic fountain is 10 minutes walk away from the hotel but does operate every day. The Bus Turistic does stop at the other side of the train station, so good for avoiding the queues at Placa de Catalunya. The standard room is basic, clean, tidy and comfortable but can suffer from noise. The buffet breakfast has a very good selection and is good value especially if you pre book with reception. I found all the staff really friendly and helpful with a good level of service. There is a pleasant rooftop terrace bar for a late night drink and pool by day, it's not very big, but it's there! For those on a budget there is a cafeteria in the train station and a large hypermarket and bakery under the hotel. This hotel is a great base to explore Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the earlier reviews -- this one is great”
Reviews.Author: pins1824
Reviews.Content: I think earlier reviews of Hotel Expo weren't good because they were still renovating. Today it is a very modern design hotel for a very good price. Very clean rooms. Definitely spend time at the pool on the top floor which has the most spectacular view, or get a drink at the restaurant there. Don't eat the food there though which is totally overpriced and not good at all. Another con, the place can be noisy. Short walk to the subway which brought us to all attractions. Main train station is there as well.

Reviews.Title: “A sure bet if you know exactly what type of hotel you're looking for”
Reviews.Author: neever
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently when moving to Barcelona to live. I chose an executive room, which was only minimally more expensive than a standard one, but was bright and spacious. On the up side, the place was spotless, the services great and the staff truly kind and helpful. On the down side, the noise from the air conditioning vents (outside the hotel) was a little irritating, and there were a few small problems in the room itself, although none so bad that they had to be fixed before I could stay (for instance, a wardrobe knob came lose and an air conditioning vent fell from the ceiling and wasn't replaced). I would think carefully before chosing the Expo however, but only because it is hard to guess what type of traveller it is aimed at. I picked it becuase it is close to the train station and I knew I would have lots of bags with me. It would seem to be a good business hotel (plenty of space to work in room, faultless pay as you go internet and a separate business centre that I didn't try), provided it is close to where you need to be, becuase the area itself is a little dead, and, relatively speaking, fairly far from the centre. I can't imagine it would be attractive to tourists, although it does have a nice pool/bar area. The staff were definitely one of the best features of the hotel - they were interested, motivated and effceint and went out of their way to help me. I'd definitely stay here again, but probably only if I needed a hotel in that particular area. It's not that it is unsuitable for non-business purposes, but just that I am sure there are better options for tourists and "leisure" visitors.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star - Average hotel, Very good Staff”
Reviews.Author: DJ10
Reviews.Content: Location is very close to big Sants station. Staff very quick and helpful at check-in, even let me stay 5 hours later for checking out as i was ill, no extra charge. Walls are very thin, although i think the noise came from upstairs not next door. As others have said, sounded like people moving chairs. Restaurant is nice but is very very expensive, 20 Euros for a buffet menu. Simming pool is nice but small. Overall, i'd say about average, plus and minus points. About 5 metro stops from Las Ramblas, if tourism is what you are after then try to get somewhere close to Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Very Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Tiki220
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Expo Hotel in Barcelona from May 17-27, 2009. We took the train from the airport to the Sants station and simply walked across the street to the hotel. We had booked an executive king room and when we saw the setup, it did not look like the picture on the web site. I went back to the front desk and they immediately moved us to a corner room on the 8th floor which was more spacious and had a window in the bathroom, providing extra light and ventilation. The room was spotless and we had a nice balcony. There are only a couple of minor negatives about the hotel--the blackout drapes behind the sheer curtains had a few small holes; we had difficulty getting the television to work several times and could not get the hotel menu to disappear and access the regular channels. We found only two channels in English--CNN and BBC News. However, during our stay, a large tour group arrived for a couple of days and suddenly the TV worked better and we actually saw Jay Leno one night near the end of our stay. I think the hotel must have done something with the satellite to make improvements. The bed was very firm, but not to the point of being uncomfortable. The shower was fantastic. The buffet breakfast was included with our stay, which we booked on the hotel's web site. The variety was good--lots of fresh fruit, smoked salmon, brie cheese, pastries, eggs, potatoes, bacon & sausage, various kinds of bread, cereal and juices. We missed having the occasional bowl of oatmeal, waffles or pancakes. However, toward the end of our 9 days, we did see french toast. The quality of the breakfast was very good and it was so convenient to grab breakfast and head out for a day of sightseeing. Be aware that there will be a slight sewer odor in the lobby at times which isn't a problem because we didn't spend any time there. This seems to be a problem throughout the city in various buildings, especially in the restrooms of restaurants, etc. We highly recommend this hotel. It is quieter than some other locations in the city, you can go to the Sants Train Station across the street to take a train virtually anywhere, the Metro is two blocks away, and there is a Supermarket right next door where you can purchase almost anything, including some great wines and cava at very reasonable prices. The front desk staff is very helpful and accommodating and the neighborhood is safe to walk, even at night. The maid did an excellent job of maintaining our room each day. We did not use the safe and no valuables were ever missing, which is so important when carrying passports, etc. We finally had a chance to use the rooftop pool on our last day. There is also a lounge up there and the views are incredible. There are lots of chaises and the attendant provides the towels. If you stay here you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: sonalim
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, walking distance from Sants Station. For an additional 6 euros we upgraded to an Executive Room. Really nice breakfast served for an additional 14 euros but it is worth the price and the selection is amazing. Staff was really nice and friendly. Metro stations very close by to the hotel. Room and bathroom was exceptionally clean. Marc C, the staff at the Business Center was really helpful and made our stay extra special.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: AkyAky
Reviews.Content: Expo hotel is near the trein station Sants..but for visit the city center we had take the metro. Good relation between price and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Basic, No triple rooms.”
Reviews.Author: IrishGalwayLady
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with two of my aunts who are in their 60's. Staff at the reception are very helpful. We booked a triple room and on arrival to the room, we saw there was only two beds. We contacted reception and there was no problem adding in another bed. Took awhile to explain we had booked a triple. Room was very basic and clean, with a walk in wardrobe. Small room even though it was a twin. There was a very small pool on the roof but would not be suited for people with disabilities, as there was only rails into it and it was deep enough, not suitable for children. The food was very nice and plenty to choose from. The food in the hotel at the restaurant was over priced and not nice. Other then that, hotel was lovely and in a great location. Only complained was the noisy air conditioning and the slippy reception area. This was due to whatever varnish they use.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job well”
Reviews.Author: Londoner5870
Reviews.Content: This hotel is never going to win prizes for architecture or ambience, but for a one-night business stay it was absolutely fine and at a reasonable price considering there was a big convention in town. The rooms are clean, comfortable and reasonably spacious. The reception is friendly and service standards overall are high. Food was straightforward and good, with the exception of a slightly random room-service breakfast. As other reviews have noted, it's in an excellent location - and I don't think you can wrong as a place for a business trip, but it isn't a top tip for relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but shoddy Internet policy”
Reviews.Author: justinecd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right beside the main train station, which was handy - rooms were clean and staff at reception very friendly. However, I wouldn't advise staying there for business - their Internet access system is outdated and the staff in the business centre were unhelpful. To get wireless Internet access in your room, which costs e10 for 24 hours, you need a separate password for each device you want to connect to the Internet, so one each for laptop and PDA. The passwords can only be obtained from the hotel's business centre, and on the first night of our stay, it took 2 phone calls to convince the staff there to give us more than one password. On the second night of the stay, I had to call the business centre 3 times, because each time I called for an Internet password the person I was dealing with mispronounced the password - replacing 'f' with 's', for instance. No problem, obviously a language issue and nothing to get upset about - however, on my third call, the person I spoke with was extremely unhelpful, speaking as if we were trying to somehow trick them out of extra passwords. Also, there are no TV channels in English. Aside from the Internet issues, a nice hotel with a good restaurant and by and large pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: Brennerman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Expo for 2 night's (Sat & Sun) as I was attending the Barca v Deportivo match. This hotel is in a great location for any travellers who wish to attend Barca games, as it's only 3 stops from Tarragona to Les Courts on the Metro green line (L3). I bought a T-10 card (€7.70) on arrival at the airport train station, and we caught the train to Sants station, which took just 25 mins. We then just walked the 300-400m to the hotel from the station. The T-10 gives you 10 journeys and can be used on the metro and the train and was a cheap and effective way for us both to get about the city - real value for money The first impressions were good, as the reception staff were very friendly and helpful, (especially Ruben) and the hotel lobby is clean & modern. I booked an Executive Twin Room and it was value for money in my opinion. We were allocated Room #825 which had a nice view towards the Museu Nacional d'Art de Catalunya (MNAC). The room was clean, modern and spacious, and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was nice and the towels were replenished each day.We had no issues with noise at all, however, I don't think the hotel was anywhere near capacity, due to the time of year. Thanks to the tips provided on here, I booked a room only basis, as I thought €16 per person for breakfast was expensive. We were actually offered breakfast at €9 per person at check-in, but declined, as the bakery and hypermarket are on the same block as the hotel as pointed out by previous reviewers. The only other minor criticism of the hotel is that they charge €3.21 per day for use of the safety deposit box in the rooms, but as I was only there for 2 night's, it wasn't a major issue On arrival, we were offered 2hrs free wifi use and given two free drink vouchers for use at the bar on the 3rd floor, which we took advantage of after dumping our stuff in our room! It's a very nicely appointed, modern bar and the service was good. (Special thanks to staff, Elena & Raul, who were both good fun). The pool terrace/bar was closed which I assume was down to the time of year, so we didn't get to see that. We didn't eat in the restaurant whilst we stayed there, however, there are 3 restaurants across the road to choose from in the immediate area. I can't remember the name of it, but the one to the right of the Marrakech bar, as you look from the hotel entrance, was good, as it had a restaurant/bar and also offered a tapas menu which suited us nicely and was reasonably priced too. Didn't go in the Marrakech Bar, and the Galician restaurant looked overpriced. Obviously, a trip to Barca isn't complete without a trip to La Ramblas and even though it looks a few stops away on the Green L3 line, if you get on at Tarragona metro station, within 5-6mins you will be at Dressanes (bottom of La Ramblas) or 7-8mins you will be at the top, Catalunya. The Metro is superb - reliable, easy to understand and very punctual. In terms of travellers worried about safety etc, we walked from Tarragona Metro station each night to the hotel late on, without any problems at all, and felt safe wherever we were in the city to be honest. I would definitely go back to Expo Hotel and would recommend it to any friends/family who were visiting Barcelona, and to top a great weekend, Barca beat Deportivo 5-0!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Useful location”
Reviews.Author: dexbrighton
Reviews.Content: got a special deal on booking.com for a 1night stay. In a great location- about 200yrds away from sants estacio, the main train station in barcelona. The area is calm and safe at night. Good for some as it is away from the touristy (and sometimes unsafe) ramblas. Modern foyer, staff friendly. Chuffed when i opend my room to one of the more expensive ones. Staff were helpful, especially when i misplaced my key on my travels. Overall, a good hotel, in a useful location and am planning to visit again in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheHotspurs
Reviews.Content: The directions on the website were easy to follow especially knowing which metro station (Sans Estacio) to get off at. Check in was fast and efficient and we were given an executive room on the 7th floor. Very impressed with the room, spacious and very clean. The view was onto the main road but for a city hotel the road noise was expected but could hardly be heard with the patio door closed. Breakfast was brilliant, such a varied selection and the staff were very polite, greeting you upon arrival. Having read lots of reviews about noise travelling through the thin walls, I have to say I did not hear anyone from either side. The ONLY thing that that did wake me up was the maid cleaning service in the corridoor at 740am. She was not speaking or making excessive noise but you could hear the equipment being used. It was not a huge problem but maybe they do come along a little bit early. The location of this hotel is brilliant. It is not in the main Ramblas but is only a few stops on the metro and makes exploring Barcelona very easy. Staff were all fantastic, very friendly. Did not experience the roof top pool or bar because it was out of season - tho the weather was still fantastic in October. Had a fantastic time and would definitely use this hotel again, very very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: daytripper123
Reviews.Content: Me and my Husband stayed in this hotel for 5 nights recently. The staff were very helpful and courteous. The Hotel was very clean. Our room was great. It was cleaned spotlessly every day and all rooms have a balcony. In terms of location, it is right next to a major train station and you can get anywhere in the city from here. We originally got a taxi from the airport to the Hotel- It cost us 30 Euros. However you can just as easily get a train direct from the Airport to the Train station right next to the hotel. The train costs the price of one metro trip which is 70 cents! So quite a price difference! The train station is called the Barcelona Sants Estacio. Overall a highly recommended hotel which i would definitely recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: GW88
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the Expo Hotel, Barcelona with my husband. Excellent, efficient check-in on arrival. We were greeted by Vincente, who was very pleasant and explained everything very clearly to us and gave us a map. We had booked an executive room and were slightly disappointed when we opened the door to a standard room - though saying that, it wasn't a bad room at all. The reception staff were very helpful in trying to locate us an Executive room, but there were none available until the following morning. The next day, we moved along the corridor to an executive room - which was really lovely. We were on the top floor in a corner room and the views were fantastic. We booked in on a 'room only' basis, but were offered the breakfast at a special rate of 9 Euros each person per day. We were very impressed with the quality of the breakfasts and were pleased we opted for them. There was a huge selection of cereals, fruits, meats, cheeses, cooked food, pastries etc ... I can recommend the smoked salmon with the scrambled eggs! We found the breakfast staff to be very polite and efficient. Housekeeping was very good, with a constant supply of clean towels/toiletries etc. Hotel is conveniently situated next to Sants train station - 20 minute journey from the airport. Round the corner is Tarragona metro, which is great for getting around. Lovely rooftop terrace which is pleasant for a late night drink. Also recommended for a late night drink is the Marrakech bar opposite the entrance to the hotel. The weather was glorious and we managed to enjoy a couple of hours by the roof-top pool before we went home. Overall, a very pleasant stay at the Expo Hotel. We would definitely return and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Base For A Barcelona Holiday”
Reviews.Author: AntMich
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner were extremely happy with the hotel. It was clean, tidy, modern and we found the staff very freindly and helpful in explaining how to get to and use the Metro system in order for us to see all the amazing sights Barcelona has to offer. What's more their english was very good. The roof terrace and pool has truly spectacular views of Barcelona and although we didnt use the restaurant it looked impressive and seemed reasonably priced too. What we found handy about this Hotel was the Hypermarket next door where you could buy fresh bread / croissants daily. As for Barcelona. An amazing place full of charm and character. A Metro system that is very easy to use with stations at all the major sites. We had a fantastic 4 days that I believe was made more special by the location and 'feel' of the Expo hotel. We would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Dane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during a long weekend - our first time in Barcelona - and found it very nice. The hotel is located right next to Sants Estacio both rail and metro station, so has easy access to the centre of the city and seafront. Our check-in was very quick and easy and staff in general were friendly. We stayed in a (newly decorated) executive room and thought it was really nice. It had a small balcony and air con, which was great during those warm nights! We only had breakfast there once and it was fine with a good selection of both warm and cold items. We paid (I think) about 15 euros, which we thought was a bit much and as there is a large supermarket right next to the hotel, we chose to get food from there. We had dinner there once as well - the hotel has a different theme every night and we chose to have dinner there for the Mexican night. Again, the food was fine if not a bit expensive for what you get. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel - and the big bonus being the rooftop swimming pool. It's not very big, but it's there!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: MustangJoe
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked us at the Expo after getting good feedback from another client she had booked. The hotel is clean and modern and well situated. It's easy to get to since it's essentially across the street from the Sants Barcelona train station. We enjoyed the rootop terrace and had an excellent cava sangria while enjoying the view of night time Barcelona. Our room rate included an "american breakfast" that had a surprisingly wide selection of items to choose from. Check in was quick and the service was great. I would certainly go back if given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: LECONT
Reviews.Content: Everything was better than we expected during our stay at Expo Hotel Barcelona. Everything was clean. The rooms were spacious and modern. We really enjoyed the bar at the terrace with great view. We were more than satisfied with the lunch. Everything in the town was easily accessed even on foot. We would pleasantly stay again at Expo hotel. John and Betty

Reviews.Title: “nowhere near 4 star”
Reviews.Author: youngchuck
Reviews.Content: must be the worst breakfast ever.staff slow to clear tables,bring coffee,never smiled."hot" buffet absolutely cold on each of three mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooftop pool, good location.”
Reviews.Author: quattromonti
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just opposite the Saints train station. Has a big sumermarket under the hotel. On the roof there is a very big swimming pool with great views of the city! Breakfast is great. Rooms are ok but coud be better!

Reviews.Title: “rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: buddywoof
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the expo hotel on our first trip to barcelona. the room we had was modern,clean and vry spacious with everything you need in it,ie; safe,fridge, tea coffee etc. the breakfast was lovely but expensive, as we didn't hav it included in the price of the room,so we only ate there the once,at 22euro each we found you could eat a lot cheaper elsewhere. the location was the only downfall as we had to ge a taxi everytime we left the hotel. the rooftop pool is a major plus as is the rooftop bar. the staff were polite and friendly-with a few exceptions. i would stay here again if i didn't want to leave the hotel but next time we will look for something more central and save on taxi's

Reviews.Title: “will give it a miss next time”
Reviews.Author: deemy
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed here for 3-5 nights around new years eve time. Booked thru hotels.com which seemed to be the cheapest for a rate of approx €150 a night.It is definatly not a 4 star hotel. We all had the 'Upgraded executive rooms' which had been recently renovated we were told. This can't be true as the bathroom seemed a little old. The tiles were years old for one. These rooms more likely got a lick of paint and some new curtins and that was it. This hotel was by far the noisest hotels I 've ever stayed at. Walls are paper thin The housekeeping started every morning at around 7am. All the rooms have tiled floors so from 7 on prepare to get no more sleep what with furniture being dragged on floors ect. The reception staff were nice if not a little slow. We were waiting 35mins in the queue to checkout. We were overcharged for mini bar stuff we did not have but was so tired couldn't be bothered arguing over the 12€. Also one of our party had terrible problems checking out whereby staff were telling him they could not accept his visa as it was being declined so a friend paid for him. He then rang visa in case there was fraud on his card and it turned out that the hotel had already been given authorisation to take the money the previous day which they had done so received double payment and there was no problem with his card, the problem was on the hotels side. I would have hated to try and sort the problem over the phone when we go home. As hotels go I guess it wasn't that bad. I wouldn't recommend it for familys with toddlers as the tiles are very rough and I niped my feet more than once. It suited us fine as we weren't sightseeing this time and were able the sleep during the afternoon(thru the noise) to energise for the nightlife. We didn't eat in the hotel. The bar menu wasn't up to much. Taxi into centre is only €5. Space nightclub is only around the corner which didn't realise till the last day. Theres a supermarket on the right as you come out of hotel also.

Reviews.Title: “EXPO ... Satisfies my Needs”
Reviews.Author: Migo_mehareb
Reviews.Content: Before, I were to Barcelona I've surfed the net to search for a 3 - to - 4 stars Hotel to stay for a couple of nights (19-21Dec). I found many, but I was much fond with Expo ( a 4 star Hotel with the price of 3). Athough I've read many negative comments in the previous travellers reviews yet when I was there in Barcelona, I asked our Headquarter there to book me a single room. I really enjoyed the stay there, the various hot and cold food items in the breakfast buffet. I have to tell you that during the previous 3 days (16-19 Dec) I've been to another popular 4 stars Hotel int he L'illa area, although with nearly double the price per night, yet the breakfast buffet is not as good as that of EXPO. Last but not least the EXPO hotel satisfies my needs, in convenient stay, food, Airport transportation, metro and bus stations...

Reviews.Title: “BARCELONA DREAM”
Reviews.Author: Alektallinn
Reviews.Content: Good breakfast buffet with a lot of differents cakes! The juice must be improve. It´s not natural. So goog cualification in general. Good staff, specially some bell-boy. Nice room, and nice view from my room from 8 floor. I was seeing the palace real. Wifi in all the hotel so paying for it. Nice conections to everywhere in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: marcadoru
Reviews.Content: Everything could be ok, but at check-out they put us to pay extra tv, even if we had not use it. Shame!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for sight-seers!”
Reviews.Author: Shackman99
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Expo for a stag weekend along with some friends. The key factor to the hotel is its ideal location to the sants station which provided excellent and efficient links to practically anwhere in the city. The hotel itself was spacious, clean and friendly and had a distinct continental feel to it. Breakfast was suitable for a large group of males, rooms where spotless and contained all neccessary amenities. Would recommend this hotel to friends or family and I may come back here in a few years time if i'm back in Barcelona, as I could not fault the experience!

Reviews.Title: “Fine View of Montjuic from the Expo”
Reviews.Author: Paulander
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends from the 9th to 16th September and whist they were very pleased with the hotel I was just pleased. The room we booked was a a triple room and for 3 persons I found it cramped with a tiny outside balcony without table or chair to sit outside. On the plus side the room was located up on the 9th floor affording a fine view of Montjuic with it s Olympic Buildings and Beautiful Museum of Catalonian Art which lights up at night with serch lights. The hotel although functional was clean and breakfast was enjoyed by all. Although the swimming pool was little bigger than a fishpond it was located on the rooftop , the area around it affording a full panoramic view of Barcelona. Although this hotel is located outside the heart of the City the excellant Metro links and adjecent Mainline Sants station make up for this shortcoming. The Staff were pleasant to deal with making my stay a positive one and the hotel itself , along with the flights from Dublin to Barcelona offered very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Old, Dirty, not worth for it.”
Reviews.Author: Benjian
Reviews.Content: The hotel declare that they are 4 star hotel, in fact, it was a 2 star hotel. The building aready have at least 30 years history and the room was very dirty and old. The worst thing is, they over-charge me 160EUR for a non-exist reason that their glass was broken. They didn't notice me and comfirm with me, they just charged it and refuse to provide any proof. BTW, the lobby is OK, the breakfest was OK, too. Just remember the room condition was bad and the hotel management was dis honest!!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be faulted”
Reviews.Author: Gedski
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Expo in July for two nights. We chose the Expo because it is only a few steps from Barcelona Sants station and we could pick a train up from the airport and be in the hotel in about half an hour all for about 2 Euros. The hotel is very smart with courteous and efficient staff, the room was spacious and clean with excellent views of the city and the hotel also offer upgrades to executive rooms for 15 euros a night. The breakfast, which is served until 11am, was the best I have ever experienced with every kind of option open to every kind of diner. The highlight was the roof terrace with an outdoor pool with terrific views over Barcelona, just the place to unwind with a cold drink from the bar after a hard days sightseeing. There are many restaurants in the area especially out towards the Nou Camp or you are only a couple of stops away from the city centre/Ramblas area. When we revisit Barcelona in the future there will only be one hotel option for me, The Expo is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location is so, so.. otherwise nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: blondiee77
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel as it was offered through a trip I booked on Gate 1 travel. It's a nice, clean hotel which is conveniently located close to the metro and train stations. There are a couple small restaurants in the area but nothing too appealing, also when I was there and this may have changed by now.. they did not offer a business center, you had to walk about 1 block down the street to use the business center at their sister hotel. Our room was a decent size, clean and had a small balcony looking out toward the city which was nice. The staff was very nice and helpful as we checked in. And the breakfast which was included with our stay was very good, in fact probably one of the best I've experienced so far. Lots of different options and served in a large dining room. There is a bar on the roof along with a swimming pool, the pool is small and very basic, but it's nice to have anyhow. Overall it was a nice place to stay. Quiet neighborhood, but maybe a little too quiet as it is far from anything touristy.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christos M
Reviews.Content: Expo is a typical bussines hotel with friendly staff, clean rooms close to the central train station and very well equiped. I didnt like its location which is 4-5 metro stations from las rablas. In my opinion Its better for bussines travellers than tourists. Rabla its just the center of everything in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “great for really busy season”
Reviews.Author: LondonFrequentflyer
Reviews.Content: This hotel gave me shelter on numerous occasions during the busy Sonar festival in June when it seemed like every other hotel in town was full. This place is so big and caters for a business clientele and we always found rooms here. Not particularly glamorous or trendy but cheap, clean, centrally located, comfortable, anonymous and with helpful and friendly staff and generous-sized rooms, it is the perfect place to return to after a night on the town. This place is extremely kitsch, like the set of a 1970s soap opera, complete with excess marble, muzak, faux potted palms, and a high chance of sharing the lift with a dashing pilot or an orthopaedic surgeon making his way to the conference rooms. Highly amusing if you like that sort of thing.

Reviews.Title: “Could be quieter”
Reviews.Author: KThewanderer
Reviews.Content: Situated ideally next to Sants Estacio for the Metro which cheap, easy air conditioned trains and relatively clean links to the city. Drawback: Major construction activity alongside the hotel which is 7 days a week, starting at 06.30 - 18.00hrs. If thats not enough the noise from the air conditioning fans make it feel like your your back aboard the aircraft. To cap all that and despite an 8th floor bedroom the view was totally obscured by the sister hotel next door which boasts 23 floors. Best sun was reflected from the 12 floor opposite or experienced at 18.00hrs. If you can take the noise, not a light sleeper, its ideal as a base to see Barcelona. Restauarants are scarce in the area but the italian opposite the main entrance creates a good pizza. Would have loved to see how the other dishes tasted but the waiter / owner was so off-putting at the thought of 'NO TIP' he was downrite rude, in fact hostile. I didn't have chance to take my euro's out before he stormed away with insults. Hotel staff are more obliging and nothind seemed too much trouble. Great breakfast. Overall, if I'd paid more I would have expected more, VALUE FOR MONEY! Look out for Daniel he's most helpful

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to enjoy Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: joachim_7
Reviews.Content: The hotel expo this one located Very well !!!, (near the sants station) the rooms are wide and comfortable, it has beautiful landscape of barcelona from the rooms, and a marvellous swimming pool to enjoy of the evenings of the Sun I recommend EXPO HOTEL BARCELONA!

Reviews.Title: “do better elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Janet19
Reviews.Content: Distinctly unlovable: after hard day's travel I was prevented from joining husband and daughters for hour by rooftop pool because I'd forgotten my swimming gear -despite plenty of loungers and few actual swimmers (albeit in costumes peeping out from under clothes). Only explanation was "it's hotel policy" and "no-one else complains" I was treated with courtesy but it was very cool. Very much a business/conference place. Management uninterested in ndividual enjoyment, despite high prices....it's "ship in, ship out, be quiet" A pity because the hotel's well-situated and the breakfast is decent (cheaper to pay in advance). There are little meannesses/inefficiencies too - a charge for the room safe, haphazard production of towels and toiletries. If you must go, avoid the noisy building site side (we luckily heard a customer complaining before accepting our rooms). Best to avoid hotel and hotel chain, I suggest.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at the expo hotel.”
Reviews.Author: colah
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel. The staff are rude & unhelpful, there is a terrible smell in the rooms from the bathroom sinks that is made worse when you run the tap. Unless you pay for an upgrade the rooms are more like a 2 star hotel with uncomfrotable beds & the decor, mattress or pillows dont look to have been changed since the 70's. Its very noisy & overpriced. We had to book out a day early but they insisted that we pay for the night anyway. Also there are limited double beds & the twins cannot be pushed together as there is a table mounted to the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Pompeymark66
Reviews.Content: The first room I was given stank to high heaven of stale smoke, even though it was supposed to be a non-smoking room (it had an ash-tray!). However, the reception staff were very friendly, spoke good English, and promptly moved me to another room which was fine. The rooms are very basic and 'cold' feeling. I wouldn't want to spend more than a day or two there. The corridors have a constant smell of bleach and there are no carpets throughout so even the slightest movement of furniture or conversations in adjacent rooms are amplified by the tiled floors. However, the price was reasonable (68 Euros) and I suppose you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Get a room on the south side”
Reviews.Author: KiwiJohn2
Reviews.Content: This place is a mixed bag: The executive rooms are bright clean and modern, no problems there. Very close to Barcelona's major train station and metro access. Front desk staff were helpful and spoke fairly good English. The downside? If your room is on the North (railway station) side of the hotel bring earplugs, you will be overlooking a 24/7 construction site until the renovations to Sants station are finished. Also, the breakfast was only average, and the public internet access expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Life Saver”
Reviews.Author: X-lango
Reviews.Content: My wife and I ended up without a hotel room upon our arrival to Barcelona because of an internet reservation gone bad. So there we were in the middle of the night and after walking around town for a little over an hour we came across the Hotel Expo. Clean, spacious rooms with a view. I couldn't ask for anything more. The price is reasonable and the help we received from the hotel staff just OUTSTANDING. The metro station is about 100 yds away from the hotel entrance but once there you have total access to the entire city. Also, train station Sants is just around the corner. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “How is this rated 4*??”
Reviews.Author: beermatt31
Reviews.Content: We paid 15 Euro a night to upgrade to an executive room which was barely worth a 3*. I think executive means recently decorated as there is nothing else to distinguish it from others (not even a tea/coffee maker). The noise from the maids moving furniture on the tiled floors whilst cleaning the rooms above is unbearable. It is impossible to sleep onwards from 7.30am. In terms of location it is fine if you dont mind taking the tube for 5 stops to get to the Ramblas. The tv only has English news channels and there are no chairs on the balcony, if you want to spend time in the room take a book or you will get bored. From the experience we had, overall this hotel is overpriced with few facilities.

Reviews.Title: “4th time we have stayed at the Expo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GIJAYNE
Reviews.Content: the Expo hotel is great for the price you pay. situated near the main train station and 2 metro stops from the centre of Barcelona. this is a quiet location but has cheap bars and some nice places to eat in area. rooms are well furnished but walls are a bit thin. but we always take ear plugs when we stay in city centre. tea/ coffee maker in room and Tv and bed is comfy. Hotel pool is great for the summer after you have had a busy day its nice to be able to sunbathe and have a dip. staff are friendly and helpful. when we return to Barcelona we will be staying at the Expo.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located - ideal for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: PerriComo
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 5 nights in the Expo in mid January 2007. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and clean. We were right on the corner of the hotel and we had a lovely unobstructed view from our balcony. The television had a wide range of european channels. CNBC and CNN were the English ones but there were also a few English programmes on the German MTV which would be ideal for younger viewers. The drinks in the mini bar are overpriced but the fridge came in very handy for keeping our own drinks and snacks chilled. The bathroom was well equiped though a little shabby around the edges. The hairdrier had seen better days but the bathroom itself was very clean. There was a rather funny smell when we turned the taps on but it didn't last for too long. The hot buffet at breakfast was a bit hit and miss. One day it might be piping hot and the next freezing cold. The cold buffet more than made up for it with a wide variety of foods to suit all tastes. The hotel is literally around the corner from the main train and metro station which is ideal for tourists as some of the major attractions are quite a distance away. There was also a person on hand at the reception to give advice on routes and places to see which was very helpful. Overall we had a very pleasant stay. The hotel staff were also very accomodating when we asked to leave our bags for a few hours on the last day.
