The only gripe we had was with the cleaning staff who made alot of noise early in the morning. Other than that... a big thumbs up for the Expo.

Reviews.Title: “A very Nice and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Camillo24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife at the end of December, 2006, the hotel was totally occupied (and we are talking about 400 rooms) they took care even of the last detail of cleanliness in all the areas the rooms were spacious and with modern details really nice also they offered an excellent and delicious breakfast type buffet. In addition the hotel is located in an excellent zone. You have nearby station train Do not forget to watch the view of the city from the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: cynophile
Reviews.Content: Just got done staying at Expo Hotel Barcelona. Paid 56 euro a night and got the newer Executive suites without needing to pay more for an upgrade. The room was excellent and so was the rest of the hotel ... the breakfast is superb. I would recommend this hotel to anybody .. it is excellent. When you check in, ask for their Executive Rooms. I am not sure what their non-Executive rooms are like. There is ethernet internet for 10 euro a day, but I took my comp to the restaurant and lobby and was able to connect for free via the wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for City break holidays”
Reviews.Author: Dartsman
Reviews.Content: I visited Barcelona for our anniversary and found the Hotel Expo perfect for the trip. Reception was very helpful, breakfast was plentiful and varied,room was tidy and comfortable, location was perfect for transport around Barcelona and most of all it was 200 yards from the train station where the train from airport arrives. I would and have recommended this hotel to friends visiting Barcelona. I had problems picking this hotel after reading reviews on this site, but my wife and I wondered what the people who posted bad reviews are looking for, if they gave this bad reviews.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not nice at all!”
Reviews.Author: Owenogglers
Reviews.Content: Expo hotel has a convienient location next to the metro station. But our room was one of the old rooms and was directly above the very noisy airconditioning engine which turned on each morning. It was so loud it was impossible to sleep. The rooms were old and the beds lumpy. All the channels available on the tv were in other languages, video on demand & the in house video system was unavailable. Breakfast was included and ok but it was very busy. When a group arrived we had to wait 30 minutes for a table. I was disappointed with the hotel, it did not meet 4 star expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellerJack
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4-star hotel; more like an average 3-star one. I've stayed in 5 different 4-star hotels in Barcelona in the past two years, and this was the worst, by far. They have upgraded rooms which they ask 15 euro a night for; this may explain the different reviews you see here. I had one of the non-upgraded rooms, on the 4th floor. Location is good but not great. If you prefer the area of the Sants station, then this is a perfect location, as it's only a 3-minute walk to the station, the airport shuttle and the metro (Tarragona is the nearest metro stop). If you're interested in the major touristic sites, virtually nothing is walking distance. The room I had was narrow and long. It smelled stuffy but this improved when I opened the window. It had two twin beds, very low and with horribly old mattresses which immediately obtain the shape of your body. There was also a sofa, tucked along the little table, so that neither of them could be used properly. The bathroon was small and rather old fashioned, although it was clean and everything worked properly. Reasonable amenities. The windows are not sound-proof, which is a problem in such a central location, especially as the construction work around the station goes on 24 hours a day. Air-conditioning didn't work. Breakfast had a mediocre selection if mediocre things. Nothing compared to some of the nicer hotels in the same area. Worst of all was the attitude of the staff: always sour, never a smile. I asked to leave a piece of luggage for two days and was refused. I asked for a non-smoking room and was lectured about how my reservation didn't specify it, and how cheap a rate I got, etc. They seem to be perfectly happy with the stream of tourist groups that the hotel focuses on. There are so much nicer hotels in Barcelona, I can't see why anyone would choose this one. When shopping around, do compare this one to 3-star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NSWgirl
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel great value for money. Staff were lovely and helpful. Room was large, modern and very clean. Huge bathroom. Great roof top pool with lovely views of barcelona. Rooftop bar lovely for a late afternoon drink. Very well located close to the main railway station/bus depot. Overall, we had a pleasant stay and would highly recommend the Expo Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another great visit”
Reviews.Author: ScottishSheila
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights here last month and for the second time had a great experience. Its excellent value for money and a great location if you want a good balance between city buzz and being able to sleep at night. The metro is across the road at Sants station - where, yes, there is major work taking place but only in normal working hours! We had a large corner room on the the eighth floor with good sized bathroom and everything was very clean with no problems. The breakfast buffet had lots of choice and set you up for the day! Reception and breakfast room staff were pleasant and helpful with many speaking very good english. Friends from Edinburgh were staying at the hotel for thier first visit to Barcelona and will use it again as very impressed with the overall quality and serveice. Finally - easy to access from the airport by train using the famous T 10 ticket.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced”
Reviews.Author: riojaexport
Reviews.Content: far too expensive for what you are getting. its next to trainstation Sants, which is probably the only good thing. old rooms for its category. long check inn-check out time you expect more when paying over 200 euros a night, even in spite of the fact that it was Tradeshow time (alimentaria) will not go back, not even when price drops to 100 euros/night in my opinion 50 euros is what it is worth maximum.

Reviews.Title: “Really good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Shorna
Reviews.Content: I went to barcelona for 1 week with my boyfriend. we choose hotel expo because we had a budget but wanted a 3/4 star hotel. And also i wanted a hotel which had a swimming pool AND bed and breakfast( which are quite hard to find without paying a hifty price). Taxi from the airport was just over 20 euros, which wasn't too bad since we only made the journey twice. I bought a twin bedroom off the internet but i asked to swap to a double when i checked in since it didn't cost any more. The service from staff was really good from reception, they all could speak a good amount of english apart from the staff that work at breakfast time. The first room we spend 1 night in, we spent most of the day out but when we came back we realised the TV wasn't working properly and the lock on the bathroom door jams, we only found that out when my boyfriend locked himself in and it took us 15 minutes to get him out. (Oh, there only 4 english channels and there are news! unless your really good at spanish then its not good for people who like to spend alot of time in their hotel). We changed the next day into a double room on thh ninth floor, this was better because we were practically a few steps away from the roof top pool (which is small but there where never more that 6 people in the pool at the same time so their load of room, oh there is plently of room to sunbathe) and also the tv worked completely better. Breakfast was really nice, i massive choice of fried food, e.g bacon, egg etc. Lots of fresh fruit and different types of pastries. The rooms have balcones, if your going soon to hotel expo and hotel sants which are located practically next door to eachother (with another hotel i can't remember its name) that there is construction taking place next to them, this didn't cause us any problems since we spent most of our time exploring barcelona and the only real time we heard noice was in the morning when we opened the doors leading to the balcony. There are two bars, one is new and located on the roof and is open until 1am to to look at the star and the great skyline, which is very good but i would advise you not to go up too late because their were hardly any tables to sit down and drink! To get around we took the metro system, for both of us for 5 days it was 33 eursos which wasn't a bad price to say that we used them all the time to get around the whole of barcelona. The lines are all over the place and the red and blue line was a 5 minutes walk from the hotel. These lines as well as the green took us to the most popular attractions. And like my aunt told me when she came back from barcelona, bring your walking sure, there are plently of sight to see and the best way apart from the metro is to walk. oh, the batroom was made out of marble, very lush and reasonably sized. Oh there is a conveince store located next to the hotel, we popped over there to pick up drinks and snacks. The hotel is really good for families and middle aged couples. but me and by boyfriend are 18 and nothing really bothered us while we were there. P.s Bring your phase book. Not alot of people in barcelona speak good english. Happy holidaying!

Reviews.Title: “Expo was better than expected”
Reviews.Author: BodynSoul
Reviews.Content: From what we read about the Expo, the worst was expected. No doubt, this is not the Hilton, not even close. But, it is not the "Hell Hole" than many have proclaimed. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. The shower, toilet, and bed were fine. The AC was a little weak, but worked. There is a park behind the hotel where you can play some basketball and a shopping center next to the hotel. I noticed gang graffitti on the park walls, so it is probably best to not be there after dark.It is within walking distance of the metro and train station. The furnishings are a little dated and the painting around the door needed work, but nothing that couldn't be tolerated. We are not there to spend time in the rooms after all.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel last weekend and I have to stay I have never stayed in a hotel with such rude and unhelpful staff. From the pool boy to the reception staff all were totally rude and completely unhelpful. There was no air conditioning in the communal areas ie. Bar - Dining room. It was like a suana. There was a mix up with the booking and it took 4 hours to get it sorted and then was extremely costly. This is a hotel I would advise any traveller to Barcelona to avoid. I will not be going back there again neither will the party I travelled with. They seem to have a complete distate for English - asking peoples nationality and room number when going to the pool area (could not quite understand why!) The place is run down the rooms are smelly and very noisy if you do not like having the air con on.

Reviews.Title: “Guaranteed not to have a good time”
Reviews.Author: is it hot or is it me
Reviews.Content: It was my niece's hen weekend and unfortunately she encountered numerous checking-in problems. The staff were completely unhelpful and some of them downright rude. Rooms that should have been doubles were booked in for 3 people. There were two rooms short. Our room was not too bad and at least it did have airconditioning unlike the communal areas such as the bar and reception which did not or maybe it did but was not switched on for some reason. The rooftop pool was a very nice thing to have. Unfortunately the pool man was a jobsworth and seemed to us to have obsessive compulsive disorder. There was no drinking of cans or eating anything by the pool and if he saw you he rushed over to give you a warning. Always moving the beds to be in rows and just making sure that you didn't have an enjoyable time. There were other instances that my niece had to intervene on too. Breakfasts charged for that were not taken and keys deactivated before the right time. The staff could do with going on a good customer service training course and also the management. I certainly would not visit this hotel again. I had the feeling that they did not like the English and made it as difficult as they could if you had a query.

Reviews.Title: “If You Want Disaster Stay Here !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the Hotel Expo after a trip with some friends, if you are expecting a four star hotel you wont find it here. The staff are unhelpful, and basically they dont care. We were booked on a three night stay and had problems for the moment we arrived. We were told that each room even though supposedly booked for two was supposed to sleep three. On being in the room, the "third bed" is a sofa bed by the entrance to the room as you walk in, to gain access to the rest of the room your best bet is to actually take a run up to the sofa bed and vault over. Room keys were de-activatedafter the 2nd night even though we were there for three nights, half the three out of fifteen had breakfast included even though it was all booked together. The award for totally nutcase must go to the life guard around the pool !!, who clearly suffers from some kind of disorder. He takes towels off beds, throws them on the foor and shouts no at you. Bearing in mind my sunbed had actually been in the same place all day, sunbeds are not to be moved, looked at or touched frankly. After complaining to this man and actually having a tug of war with a sunbed, i went in search of the manager, over three days their was only a manager on site for one morning. However someone from the desk came up and spoke to him and all sorted......... until the next day when he done exactly the same. The aircon doesnt seem to work in any public areas of the hotel, other than that Barcelona is lovely !"!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pathetic. The rooms were small, there was barely enough room to pass between the bottom of the bed and the wall. The room smelt of sewage which eminated from the bathroom. The noise was worse than in any hotel I have ever stayed in. Walls are paper thin and people having sex and the noise of the cleaners is awful. Also, there was renovations and jackhammer drills going from 10 a.m. When I complained to the manageress, she said that it didn't matter check out time was 12, that people should expect noise from 10. Parking is expensive. Good points? Close to metro but not a great area really. I wouldn't if I were you.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms were dirty, there is a smell of sewerage in the rooms we went in. (had to move rooms twice). The beds were comfortable. Showers worked well. The smell of sewerage is also surrounding the building and i feel it is from the local water. The bedding is very old and tired. Balconies have good views. My tip.......Go to a hotel off season and book one in the centre when you arrive. Don't risk these really dodgy hotels. Visit Monserrat as it is out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very down hearted when i read the reviews. I was so looking forward to this holiday and wanted to enjoy it. First impressions the hotel reception was really nice, the staff were really helpful. Ok, the rooms are small and basic but they are spotless and cleaned everyday. I wasnt too keen on the breakfast but it seemed to be going down well with others. All in all i really enjoyed my stay here and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic”
Reviews.Author: E&JJJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in early June. Having read reports ,asked receptionist for a good view room on seventh floor which she kindly gave us. The room was one of the narrowest we've ever had in a hotel, very basic with quite a nice bathroom, balcony and beautiful view over West Barcelona. The hotel was easy walking distance to station and underground and we loved Barcelona.(Go on the tour-bus to see it all if you haven't much time there.) Breakfast on the first morning was very good but it went steadily downhill from then. A man at the table next to ours lit up a cigarette even though there was a perfectly good smoking room right next door to the restaurant - not sure if the restaurant was non-smoking,but he was the only one selfish enough to do so. The resident tramp was still there in a doorway near the entrance, which another reviewer had remarked on quite a while ago. I'm sure there are far better hotels than this to try in Barcelona and now we know our way around, when we go back again, we'll certainly seek out one of them!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints at all!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 4 night stay in the Expo Hotel. The room was large and tidy, very clean and with a walk in closet and an exellent bathroom. It also had a balcony with an exellent view. The pool on the roof was a bit cold, but what a view! Right beneath the hotel there was a large supermarket, and the Sants station was only a few minutes walk away. We have no complaints at all, Expo is an exellent hotel and we would definitely recommend it to anyone, and if we ever go back to Barcelona, we will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The absolutely worst!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at the expo was shortlived and thank God for that!!! First of all the hotel looks nothing like the pictures advertised- it is an old and ugly building in a run down business district with graffiti sprayed on the nearby buildings. We arrived late in the evening and were tired and hungry but no food was served past 10pm in the hotel, there was no room service, no nearby restaurants that served food either. they were all only serving drinks at that hour! As a result, we had peanuts that bought from the airport as our dinner. The staff weren't friendly or helpful either. We also found that our room was number - 666!! and to make things worse it had a horrible wet carpet smell and a loud noise was constantly coming from the toilet. Needless to say we booked another hotel that night and checked out immediately the next morning!! Take my advice.. do NOT stay here!

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: smilern.ireland
Reviews.Content: this hotel is not a 4 star hotel would give it 3 star, but the staff was very helpful to us and the breakfast was good, and near the subway
